" But do [you]136-the professor really mean , [Sir]1405-sir , "[38-peter] said [Peter]38-peter , " that there could be other worlds -- all over [the place]1425-the place , just round the corner -- like that ? "[38-peter]

" Nothing is more probable , "[136-the professor] said [the Professor]136-the professor , taking off [his]136-the professor spectacles and beginning to polish them , while [he]136-the professor muttered to [himself]136-the professor , " [I]136-the professor wonder what [they]1426-they do teach [them]1426-they at [these schools]1410-these schools . "[136-the professor]

" But what are [we]341-both of them to do ? "[40-susan] said [Susan]40-susan . [She]40-susan felt that the conversation was beginning to get off the point .

" [[My]136-the professor dear [young lady]1429-young lady]1428-my dear young lady , "[136-the professor] said [the Professor]136-the professor , suddenly looking up with a very sharp expression at [both of [them]341-both of them]341-both of them , " there is one plan which [no one]1221-no one has yet suggested and which is well worth trying . "[136-the professor]

" What 's that ? "[40-susan] said [Susan]40-susan .

" [We]341-both of them might all try minding [our]341-both of them own business , "[136-the professor] said [he]136-the professor . And that was the end of that conversation .

After this things were a good deal better for [Lucy]60-lucy . [Peter]38-peter saw to it that [Edmund]36-edmund stopped jeering at [her]60-lucy , and neither [she]60-lucy nor [anyone else]342-anyone else felt inclined to talk about the wardrobe at all . It had become a rather alarming subject . And so for a time it looked as if all the adventures were coming to an end ; but that was not to be .

[This house of the Professor's]343-this house of the professor's -- which even [he]136-the professor knew so little about -- was so old and famous that [people from all over [England]13-england]344-people from all over england used to come and ask permission to see over [it]343-this house of the professor's . [It]343-this house of the professor's was [the sort of house that is mentioned in guide books and even in histories]345-the sort of house that is mentioned in guide books and even in histories ; and well [it]343-this house of the professor's might be , for all manner of stories were told about it , some of them even stranger than the one [I]0-i am telling [you]346-you now . And when [parties of sight - seers]347-parties of sight - seers arrived and asked to see [the house]1228-the house , [the Professor]136-the professor always gave [them]347-parties of sight - seers permission , and [Mrs. Macready]41-mrs. macready , [the housekeeper]350-the housekeeper , showed [them]347-parties of sight - seers round , telling [them]347-parties of sight - seers about the pictures and the armour , and the rare books in [the library]351-the library . [Mrs. Macready]41-mrs. macready was not fond of [children]117-children , and did not like to be interrupted when [she]41-mrs. macready was telling [visitors]353-visitors all the things [she]41-mrs. macready knew . [She]41-mrs. macready had said to [Susan]40-susan and [Peter]38-peter almost on the first morning ( along with a good many other instructions ) " And please remember [you]347-parties of sight - seers 're to keep out of the way whenever [I]41-mrs. macready 'm taking a party over [the house]1228-the house . "[41-mrs. macready]

" Just as if any of [us]1432-us would want to waste half the morning trailing round with [a crowd of [strange grown - ups]1434-strange grown - ups]1433-a crowd of strange grown - ups ! "[36-edmund] said [Edmund]36-edmund , and [the other three]226-the other three thought the same . That was how the adventures began for the second time .

A few mornings later [Peter]38-peter and [Edmund]36-edmund were looking at the suit of armour and wondering if [they]226-the other three could take it to bits when [the two girls]355-the two girls rushed into [the room]165-the room and said , " Look out ! Here comes [the Macready]41-mrs. macready and [a whole gang]1435-a whole gang with [her]41-mrs. macready . "[355-the two girls]

" [Sharp]63-sharp 's the word , "[38-peter] said [Peter]38-peter , and [all four]357-all four made off through the door at the far end of [the room]165-the room . But when [they]357-all four had got out into [the Green Room]359-the green room and beyond [it]359-the green room , into [the library]351-the library , [they]357-all four suddenly heard voices ahead of [them]357-all four , and realised that [Mrs. Macready]41-mrs. macready must be bringing [[her]41-mrs. macready party of [sight - seers]362-sight - seers]361-her party of sight - seers up the back stairs -- instead of up the front stairs as [they]357-all four had expected . And after that -- whether it was that [they]357-all four lost [their]357-all four heads , or that [Mrs. Macready]41-mrs. macready was trying to catch [them]357-all four , or that some magic in [the house]1228-the house had come to life and was chasing [them]357-all four into [Narnia]7-narnia -- [they]357-all four seemed to find [themselves]357-all four being followed everywhere , until at last [Susan]40-susan said , " Oh bother [those trippers]1436-those trippers ! Here -- let 's get into [the Wardrobe Room]1437-the wardrobe room till [they]1436-those trippers 've passed . [No one]1221-no one will follow [us]357-all four in [there]283-there . "[40-susan] But the moment [they]357-all four were inside [they]357-all four heard voices in [the passage]223-the passage -- and then [someone fumbling at the door]365-someone fumbling at the door -- and then [they]357-all four saw the handle turning .

" Quick ! "[38-peter] said [Peter]38-peter , " there 's nowhere else , "[38-peter] and flung open the wardrobe . [All four of [them]357-all four]366-all four of them bundled inside [it]367-it and sat there , panting , in the dark . [Peter]38-peter held the door closed but did not shut it ; for , of course , [he]38-peter remembered , as [every sensible person]368-every sensible person does , that [you]368-every sensible person should never never shut [yourself]368-every sensible person up in [a wardrobe]175-a wardrobe .

CHAPTER VI

_ Into [the Forest]3-the forest _

" [I]40-susan wish [the Macready]41-mrs. macready would hurry up and take [all these people]1440-all these people away , "[40-susan] said [Susan]40-susan presently , " [I]40-susan 'm getting horribly cramped . "[40-susan]

" And what a filthy smell of camphor ! "[36-edmund] said [Edmund]36-edmund .

" [I]40-susan expect the pockets of these coats are full of it , "[40-susan] said [Susan]40-susan , " to keep away moths . "[40-susan]

" There 's something sticking into [my]38-peter back , "[38-peter] said [Peter]38-peter .

" And is n't it cold ? "[40-susan] said [Susan]40-susan .

" Now that [you]40-susan mention it , it is cold , "[38-peter] said [Peter]38-peter , " and hang it all , it 's wet too . What 's the matter with [this place]254-this place ? [I]38-peter 'm sitting on something wet . It 's getting wetter every minute . "[38-peter] [He]38-peter struggled to [his]38-peter feet .

" Let 's get out , "[36-edmund] said [Edmund]36-edmund , " [they]1442-they 've gone . "[36-edmund]

" O - o - oh ! "[40-susan] said [Susan]40-susan suddenly . And [everyone]153-everyone asked [her]40-susan what was the matter .

" [I]40-susan 'm sitting against a tree , "[40-susan] said [Susan]40-susan , " and look ! It 's getting lighter -- over there . "[40-susan]

" By jove , [you]40-susan 're right , "[38-peter] said [Peter]38-peter , " and look there -- and there . It 's trees all round . And this wet stuff is snow . Why , [I]38-peter do believe [we]371-all four children 've got into [[Lucy]60-lucy 's wood]1443-lucy 's wood after all . "[38-peter]

And now there was no mistaking it and [all four children]371-all four children stood blinking in the daylight of a winter day . Behind [them]371-all four children were coats hanging on pegs , in front of [them]371-all four children were snow - covered trees .

[Peter]38-peter turned at once to [Lucy]60-lucy .

" [I]38-peter apologise for not believing [you]60-lucy , "[38-peter] [he]38-peter said , " [I]38-peter 'm sorry . Will [you]60-lucy shake hands ? "[38-peter]

" Of course , "[60-lucy] said [Lucy]60-lucy , and did .

" Ugh ! "[40-susan] said [Susan]40-susan , stamping [her]40-susan feet , " it 's pretty cold . What about putting on some of these coats ? "[40-susan]

" They 're not [ours]371-all four children , "[38-peter] said [Peter]38-peter doubtfully .

" [I]38-peter never thought of that , [Su]64-su , "[38-peter] said [Peter]38-peter . " Of course , now [you]64-su put it that way , [I]38-peter see . [They]372-they immediately carried out [Susan]40-susan 's very sensible plan . But [they]372-they all felt a good deal warmer and [each]373-each thought [the others]1252-the others looked better in [their]1252-the others new get - up and more suitable to the landscape .

" [We]372-they can pretend [we]372-they are [Arctic explorers]1450-arctic explorers , "[60-lucy] said [Lucy]60-lucy .

" This is going to be exciting enough without any pretending , "[38-peter] said [Peter]38-peter , as [he]38-peter began leading the way forward into [the forest]202-the forest . There were heavy darkish clouds overhead and it looked as if there might be more snow before night .

" [I]36-edmund say , "[36-edmund] began [Edmund]36-edmund presently , " ought n't [we]372-they to be bearing a bit more to the left , that is , if [we]372-they are aiming for the lamp - post . " Well , of [all the poisonous little beasts--]1452-all the poisonous little beasts-- "[38-peter] said [Peter]38-peter and shrugged [his]38-peter shoulders and said no more . "[36-edmund]

" What about going to see [Mr. Tumnus]49-mr. tumnus ? "[60-lucy] said [Lucy]60-lucy . " [He]49-mr. tumnus 's the nice Faun [I]60-lucy told [you]60-lucy about . "[60-lucy]

[Everyone]153-everyone agreed to this and off [they]153-everyone went , walking briskly and stamping [their]153-everyone feet . [Lucy]60-lucy proved [a good leader]380-a good leader . At first [she]60-lucy wondered whether [she]60-lucy would be able to find the way , but [she]60-lucy recognised an odd - looking tree in one place and a stump in another and brought [them]153-everyone on to where the ground became uneven and into [the little valley]381-the little valley and at last to the very door of [[Mr. Tumnus]49-mr. tumnus ' cave]382-mr. tumnus ' cave . But there a terrible surprise awaited [them]153-everyone .

The door had been wrenched off its hinges and broken to bits . Inside , [the cave]383-the cave was dark and cold and had the damp feel and smell of [a place that had not been lived in for several days]384-a place that had not been lived in for several days . Snow had drifted in from the doorway and was heaped on the floor , mixed with something black , which turned out to be the charred sticks and ashes from the fire . [Someone]302-someone had apparently flung it about [the room]165-the room and then stamped it out . The crockery lay smashed on the floor and the picture of [[the Faun]179-the faun 's father]388-the faun 's father had been slashed into shreds with a knife .

" This is a pretty good wash - out , "[36-edmund] said [Edmund]36-edmund , " not much good coming here . "[36-edmund]

LONG LIVE [THE QUEEN]269-the queen ! "[269-the queen]

" So do [I]139-the girls , "[139-the girls] said both [the girls]139-the girls .

( [You]395-you could n't have found [a robin with a redder chest or a brighter eye]396-a robin with a redder chest or a brighter eye . )

" Do [you]69-the robin know , "[60-lucy] said [Lucy]60-lucy , " [I]60-lucy really believe [he]47-the faun means [us]394-the four children to follow [him]47-the faun . "[60-lucy]

" [I]40-susan 've an idea [he]47-the faun does , "[40-susan] said [Susan]40-susan , " what do [you]38-peter think , [Peter]38-peter ? "[40-susan]

" Well , [we]394-the four children might as well try it , "[38-peter] answered [Peter]38-peter .

[The Robin]69-the robin appeared to understand the matter thoroughly . [It]69-the robin kept going from tree to tree , always a few yards ahead of [them]139-the girls but always so near that [they]139-the girls could easily follow it . In this way it led [them]139-the girls on , slightly down hill . Wherever [the Robin]69-the robin alighted a little shower of snow would fall off the branch . Presently the clouds parted overhead and the winter sun came out and the snow all around [them]139-the girls grew dazzlingly bright . [They]139-the girls had been travelling in this way for about half an hour , with [the two girls]355-the two girls in front , when [Edmund]36-edmund said to [Peter]38-peter , " If [you]38-peter 're not still too high and mighty to talk to [me]36-edmund , [I]36-edmund 've something to say which [you]38-peter 'd better listen to . "[36-edmund]

" If it comes to that , which _ is _ the right side ? CHAPTER VII

_ A Day with [the Beavers]37-the beavers _

While [the two boys]398-the two boys were whispering behind , [both the girls]399-both the girls suddenly cried " Oh ! "[38-peter] and stopped . " The robin ! "[60-lucy] cried [Lucy]60-lucy , " the robin . It 's flown away . "[60-lucy] And so it had -- right out of sight .

" And now what are [we]139-the girls to do ? "[36-edmund] said [Edmund]36-edmund , giving [Peter]38-peter a look which was as much as to say " What did [I]36-edmund tell [you]38-peter ? "[36-edmund]

" Sh ! Look ! "[40-susan] said [Susan]40-susan .

" What ? "[38-peter] said [Peter]38-peter .

" There 's something moving among the trees -- over there to the left . "[36-edmund]

[They]398-the two boys all stared as hard as [they]398-the two boys could , and [no one]1221-no one felt very comfortable .

" There it goes again , "[40-susan] said [Susan]40-susan presently .

" [I]38-peter saw it that time too , "[38-peter] said [Peter]38-peter . " It 's still there . It 's just gone behind that big tree . "[38-peter]

" What is it ? "[60-lucy] asked [Lucy]60-lucy , trying very hard not to sound nervous .

" Whatever it is , "[38-peter] said [Peter]38-peter , " it 's dodging [us]398-the two boys . It 's something that does n't want to be seen . "[38-peter]

" Let 's go [home]1250-home , "[40-susan] said [Susan]40-susan . And then , though [nobody]1288-nobody said it out loud , [everyone]153-everyone suddenly realised the same fact that [Edmund]36-edmund had whispered to [Peter]38-peter at the end of the last chapter . [They]398-the two boys were lost .

" What 's it like ? "[60-lucy] said [Lucy]60-lucy .

" It's -- it 's a kind of animal , "[40-susan] said [Susan]40-susan ; and then , " Look ! Look ! Quick ! There it is . "[40-susan]

[They]398-the two boys all saw [it]403-it this time , a whiskered furry face which had looked out at [them]398-the two boys from behind a tree . But this time it did n't immediately draw back . Instead , the animal put its paw against [its]403-it mouth just as [humans]1279-humans put [their]1279-humans finger on [their]1279-humans lips when [they]1279-humans are signalling to [you]405-you to be quiet . Then it disappeared again . [The children]391-the children all stood holding [their]391-the children breaths .

A moment later [the stranger]407-the stranger came out from behind the tree , glanced all round as if it were afraid [someone]302-someone was watching , said " Hush , "[407-the stranger] made signs to [them]398-the two boys to join [it]407-the stranger in the thicker bit of wood where it was standing , and then once more disappeared .

" [I]38-peter know what it is , "[38-peter] said [Peter]38-peter , " it 's a beaver . [I]38-peter saw the tail . "[38-peter]

" [It]407-the stranger wants [us]398-the two boys to go to it , "[40-susan] said [Susan]40-susan , " and it is warning [us]398-the two boys not to make a noise . "[40-susan]

" [I]38-peter know , "[38-peter] said [Peter]38-peter . " The question is are [we]398-the two boys to go to it or not ? What do [you]38-peter think , [Lu]60-lucy ? "[38-peter]

" [I]60-lucy think it 's a nice beaver , "[60-lucy] said [Lucy]60-lucy .

" Yes , but how do [we]398-the two boys _ know _ ? "[36-edmund] said [Edmund]36-edmund .

" Sha n't [we]398-the two boys have to risk it ? "[40-susan] said [Susan]40-susan . " [I]40-susan mean , it 's no good just standing here and [I]40-susan feel [I]40-susan want some dinner . "[40-susan]

At this moment [the Beaver]71-mr. beaver again popped its head out from behind the tree and beckoned earnestly to [them]409-them .

" Come on , "[38-peter] said [Peter]38-peter , " let 's give it a try . [All]1492-all keep close together . [We]398-the two boys ought to be a match for one beaver if it turns out to be [an enemy]1493-an enemy . "[38-peter]

So [the children]391-the children all got close together and walked up to the tree and in behind it , and there , sure enough , [they]391-the children found [the Beaver]71-mr. beaver ; but it still drew back , saying to [them]409-them in a hoarse throaty whisper , " Further in , come further in . Right in here . [We]398-the two boys 're not safe in the open ! "[71-mr. beaver] Only when it had led [them]409-them into a dark spot where four trees grew so close together that [their]411-their boughs met and the brown earth and pine needles could be seen underfoot because no snow had been able to fall there , did it begin to talk to [them]409-them .

" Are [you]409-them [the Sons of [Adam]48-adam]1494-the sons of adam and [the Daughters of [Eve]48-adam]1495-the daughters of eve ? "[71-mr. beaver] it said .

" [We]398-the two boys 're [some of [them]1494-the sons of adam]1496-some of them , "[38-peter] said [Peter]38-peter .

" S - s - s - sh ! "[71-mr. beaver] said [the Beaver]71-mr. beaver , " not so loud please . [We]398-the two boys 're not safe even here . "[71-mr. beaver]

" Why , who are [you]71-mr. beaver afraid of ? "[38-peter] said [Peter]38-peter . " There 's [no one]1221-no one here but [ourselves]398-the two boys . "[38-peter]

" There are the trees , "[71-mr. beaver] said [the Beaver]71-mr. beaver . " [They]411-their 're always listening . [Most of [them]411-their]1498-most of them are on [our]398-the two boys side , but there _ are _ trees that would betray [us]398-the two boys to _ [her]1499-her _ ; [you]1500-you know who [I]71-mr. beaver mean , "[71-mr. beaver] and it nodded [its]71-mr. beaver head several times .

" If it comes to talking about sides , "[36-edmund] said [Edmund]36-edmund , " how do [we]398-the two boys know [you]71-mr. beaver 're [a friend]1249-a friend ? "[36-edmund]

" Not meaning to be rude , [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver , "[38-peter] added [Peter]38-peter , " but [you]71-mr. beaver see , [we]398-the two boys 're [strangers]1502-strangers . "[38-peter]

" Quite right , quite right , "[71-mr. beaver] said [the Beaver]71-mr. beaver . " Here is [my]71-mr. beaver token . "[71-mr. beaver] With these words it held up to [them]412-them a little white object . [They]412-them all looked at it in surprise , till suddenly [Lucy]60-lucy said , " Oh , of course . It 's [my]60-lucy handkerchief -- the one [I]60-lucy gave to [poor Mr. Tumnus]49-mr. tumnus . "[60-lucy]

" That 's right , "[71-mr. beaver] said [the Beaver]71-mr. beaver . " [Poor fellow]1503-poor fellow , [he]1503-poor fellow got wind of the arrest before it actually happened and handed this over to [me]71-mr. beaver . [He]1503-poor fellow said that if anything happened to [him]1503-poor fellow [I]71-mr. beaver must meet [you]391-the children here and take [you]391-the children on to-- "[71-mr. beaver] Here [the Beaver]71-mr. beaver 's voice sank into silence and it gave one or two very mysterious nods . Then signalling to [the children]391-the children to stand as close around [it]71-mr. beaver as [they]391-the children possibly could , so that [their]391-the children faces were actually tickled by its whiskers , it added in a low whisper--

" [They]391-the children say [Aslan]72-aslan is on the move -- perhaps has already landed . "[72-aslan]

And now a very curious thing happened . [None of [the children]391-the children]414-none of the children knew who [Aslan]72-aslan was any more than [you]416-you do ; but the moment [the Beaver]71-mr. beaver had spoken these words [everyone]153-everyone felt quite different . Perhaps it has sometimes happened to [you]416-you in a dream that [someone]302-someone says something which [you]416-you do n't understand but in the dream it feels as if it had some enormous meaning -- either a terrifying one which turns the whole dream into a nightmare or else a lovely meaning too lovely to put into words , which makes the dream so beautiful that [you]416-you remember it all [your]416-you life and are always wishing [you]416-you could get into that dream again . It was like that now . At the name of [Aslan]72-aslan [each one of [the children]391-the children]419-each one of the children felt something jump in [his]419-each one of the children inside . [Edmund]36-edmund felt a sensation of mysterious horror . [Peter]38-peter felt suddenly brave and adventurous . [Susan]40-susan felt as if some delicious smell or some delightful strain of music had just floated by [her]40-susan . And [Lucy]60-lucy got the feeling [you]416-you have when [you]416-you wake up in the morning and realise that it is the beginning of the holidays or the beginning of summer .

" And what about [Mr. Tumnus]49-mr. tumnus , "[60-lucy] said [Lucy]60-lucy ; " where is [he]49-mr. tumnus ? "[60-lucy]

" S - s - s - sh , "[71-mr. beaver] said [the Beaver]71-mr. beaver , " not [here]1219-here . [I]71-mr. beaver must bring [you]416-you where [we]153-everyone can have a real talk and also dinner . "[71-mr. beaver]

[No one]1221-no one except [Edmund]36-edmund felt any difficulty about trusting [the Beaver]71-mr. beaver now and [everyone]153-everyone , including [Edmund]36-edmund , was very glad to hear the word " dinner . "[153-everyone] [They]153-everyone therefore all hurried along behind [[their]153-everyone new friend]423-their new friend who led [them]153-everyone at a surprisingly quick pace , and always in [the thickest parts of [the forest]202-the forest]424-the thickest parts of the forest , for over an hour . [Everyone]153-everyone was feeling very tired and very hungry when suddenly the trees began to get thinner in front of [them]153-everyone and the ground to fall steeply down [hill]427-hill . A minute later [they]153-everyone came out under the open sky ( the sun was still shining ) and found [themselves]153-everyone looking down on a fine sight .

[They]153-everyone were standing on the edge of [a steep , narrow valley at the bottom of which ran]428-a steep , narrow valley at the bottom of which ran -- at least it would have been running if it had n't been frozen -- [a fairly large river]429-a fairly large river . Just below [them]153-everyone a dam had been built across [this river]430-this river ; and when [they]153-everyone saw it [everyone]153-everyone suddenly remembered that of course [beavers]432-beavers are always making dams and felt quite sure that [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver had made this one . [They]153-everyone also noticed that [he]71-mr. beaver now had a sort of modest expression on [his]71-mr. beaver face -- the sort of look [people]1289-people have when [you]434-you are visiting [a garden]435-a garden [they]1289-people 've made or reading a story [they]1289-people 've written . So it was only common politeness when [Susan]40-susan said , " What [a lovely dam]1505-a lovely dam ! "[40-susan] And [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver did n't say " Hush "[71-mr. beaver] this time but " Merely a trifle ! Merely a trifle ! And it is n't really finished ! "[71-mr. beaver]

Above the dam there was what ought to have been a deep pool but was now of course a level floor of dark green ice . And below [the dam]436-the dam , much lower down , was more ice , but instead of being smooth this was all frozen into the foamy and wavy shapes in which the water had been rushing along at the very moment when the frost came . And where the water had been trickling over and spurting through the dam there was now a glittering wall of icicles , as if the side of [the dam]436-the dam had been covered all over with flowers and wreaths and festoons of the purest sugar . And out in the middle , and partly on the top of [the dam]436-the dam , was [a funny little house]439-a funny little house shaped rather like an enormous bee - hive and from a hole in the roof smoke was going up , so that when [you]434-you saw [it]439-a funny little house ( especially if [you]434-you were hungry ) [you]434-you at once thought of cooking and became hungrier than [you]434-you were before .

That was what [the others chiefly]440-the others chiefly noticed , but [Edmund]36-edmund noticed something else . A little lower down [the river]1361-the river there was [another small river which came down [another small valley]443-another small valley to join [it]442-another small river which came down another small valley to join it]442-another small river which came down another small valley to join it . And looking up [that valley]444-that valley , [Edmund]36-edmund could see [two small hills]445-two small hills , and [he]36-edmund was almost sure they were the two hills which [the White Witch]1261-the white witch had pointed out to [him]36-edmund when [he]36-edmund parted from [her]1261-the white witch at the lamp - post that other day . And then between [them]445-two small hills , [he]36-edmund thought , must be [[her]1261-the white witch palace]447-her palace , only a mile off or less . And [he]36-edmund thought about [Turkish Delight]58-turkish delight and about being [a King]448-a king ( " And [I]36-edmund wonder how [Peter]38-peter will like that ? "[36-edmund] [he]36-edmund asked [himself]36-edmund ) and horrible ideas came into [his]36-edmund head .

" [Here]1219-here [we]1507-we are , "[71-mr. beaver] said [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver , " and it looks as if [Mrs. Beaver]73-mrs. beaver is expecting [us]1507-we . [I]71-mr. beaver 'll lead the way . But be careful and do n't slip . "[71-mr. beaver]

[The top of [the dam]436-the dam]449-the top of the dam was wide enough to walk on , though not ( for [humans]1279-humans ) a very nice place to walk because [it]449-the top of the dam was covered with ice , and though [the frozen pool]452-the frozen pool was level with [it]449-the top of the dam on one side , there was a nasty drop to [the lower river]453-the lower river on the other . Along this route [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver led [them]454-they in single file right out to the middle where [they]454-they could look a long way up [the river]1361-the river and a long way down it . And when [they]454-they had reached the middle [they]454-they were at the door of [the house]1228-the house .

" Here [we]454-they are , [Mrs. Beaver]73-mrs. beaver , "[71-mr. beaver] said [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver , " [I]71-mr. beaver 've found [them]454-they . Here are [the Sons and Daughters of [Adam]74-the sons and daughters of adam and eve"--and they all and Eve"--and[71-mr. beaver] [they]454-they all]74-the sons and daughters of adam and eve"--and they all went in .

The first thing [Lucy]60-lucy noticed as [she]60-lucy went in was a burring sound , and the first thing [she]60-lucy saw was a kind - looking old [she]457-her - beaver sitting in the corner with a thread in [her]457-her mouth working busily at [her]457-her sewing machine and it was from it that the sound came . [She]60-lucy stopped [her]60-lucy work and got up as soon as [the children]391-the children came in .

" So [you]71-mr. beaver 've come at last ! "[60-lucy] [she]60-lucy said , holding out both [her]60-lucy wrinkled old paws . " At last ! To think that ever [I]60-lucy should live to see this day ! The potatoes are on boiling and the kettle 's singing and [I]60-lucy daresay , [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver , [you]71-mr. beaver 'll get [us]391-the children some fish . "[60-lucy]

" That [I]71-mr. beaver will , "[71-mr. beaver] said [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver and [he]71-mr. beaver went out of [the house]1228-the house ( [Peter]38-peter went with [him]71-mr. beaver ) and across the ice of [the deep pool]460-the deep pool to where [he]71-mr. beaver had a little hole in the ice which [he]71-mr. beaver kept open every day with [his]71-mr. beaver hatchet . [They]391-the children took a pail with [them]391-the children , [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver sat down quietly at the edge of the hole ( [he]71-mr. beaver did n't seem to mind it 's being so chilly ) looked hard into it , then suddenly shot in [his]71-mr. beaver paw , and before [you]461-you could say [Jack Robinson]75-jack robinson had whisked out a beautiful trout . Then [he]71-mr. beaver did it all over again until [they]391-the children had a fine catch of fish .

Meanwhile [the girls]139-the girls were helping [Mrs. Beaver]73-mrs. beaver to fill the the kettle and lay the table and cut the bread and put the plates in the oven to heat and draw a huge jug of beer for [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver from a barrel which stood in one corner of [the house]1228-the house , and to put on the frying pan and get the dripping hot . [Lucy]60-lucy thought [the Beavers]37-the beavers had [a very snug little home]464-a very snug little home though [it]464-a very snug little home was not at all like [[Mr. Tumnus]49-mr. tumnus 's cave]465-mr. tumnus 's cave . There were no books or pictures and instead of beds there were bunks , like on [board ship]466-board ship , built into the wall . And there were hams and strings of onions hanging from the roof and against the walls were gum boots and oilskins and hatchets and pairs of shears and spades and trowels and things for carrying mortar in and fishing rods and fishing nets and sacks . And the cloth on the table tho ' very clean was very rough .

Just as the frying pan was nicely hissing [Peter]38-peter and [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver came in with the fish which [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver had already opened with [his]71-mr. beaver knife and cleaned out in the open air . [You]461-you can think how good the new - caught fish smelled while [they]37-the beavers were frying and how [the hungry children]467-the hungry children longed for [them]37-the beavers to be done and how very much hungrier still [they]37-the beavers had become before [Mrs. Beaver]73-mrs. beaver said , " Now [we]37-the beavers 're nearly ready . "[73-mrs. beaver] [Susan]40-susan drained the potatoes and then put them all back in the empty pot to dry on the side of [the range]468-the range while [Lucy]60-lucy was helping [Mrs. Beaver]73-mrs. beaver to dish up the trout , so that in a very few minutes [everyone]153-everyone was drawing up stools ( it was all three - legged stools in [[the Beavers]37-the beavers ' house]470-the beavers ' house except for [Mrs. Beaver]73-mrs. beaver 's own special rocking chair beside the fire ) and preparing to enjoy [themselves]153-everyone . There was a jug of creamy milk for [the children]391-the children ( [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver stuck to beer ) and a great big lump of deep yellow butter in the middle of the table from which [everyone]153-everyone took as much as [he]153-everyone wanted to go with [his]153-everyone potatoes and all [the children]391-the children thought -- and [I]0-i agree with [them]391-the children -- that there 's nothing to beat good freshwater fish if [you]474-you eat it when it has been alive half an hour ago and has come out of the pan half a minute ago . And when [they]391-the children had finished the fish [Mrs. Beaver]73-mrs. beaver brought unexpectedly out of the oven a great and gloriously sticky marmalade roll , steaming hot , and at the same time moved the kettle on to the fire , so that when [they]391-the children had finished the marmalade roll the tea was made and ready to be poured out . And when [each person]475-each person had got [his]476-his ( or [her]477-her ) cup of tea , [each person]475-each person shoved back [his]476-his ( or [her]477-her ) stool so as to be able to lean against the wall and gave a long sigh of contentment .

" And now , "[71-mr. beaver] said [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver pushing away [his]71-mr. beaver empty beer mug and pulling [his]71-mr. beaver cup of tea towards [him]71-mr. beaver , " if [you]474-you 'll just wait till [I]71-mr. beaver 've got [my]71-mr. beaver pipe lit up and going nicely -- why , now [we]391-the children can get to business . It 's snowing again , "[71-mr. beaver] [he]71-mr. beaver added , cocking [his]71-mr. beaver eye at the window . " That 's all the better , because it means [we]391-the children sha n't have [any visitors]1508-any visitors ; and if [anyone]325-anyone should have been trying to follow [you]474-you , why [he]325-anyone wo n't find any tracks . "[71-mr. beaver]

CHAPTER VIII

" What 's that to do with it ? "[38-peter] asked [Peter]38-peter .

" Because of another prophecy , "[71-mr. beaver] said [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver . " Down at [Cair Paravel]8-cair paravel -- that 's the castle on [the sea]1565-the sea coast down at [the mouth of [this river]430-this river]1566-the mouth of this river which ought to be [the capital of [the whole country]1471-the whole country]1568-the capital of the whole country if all was as it should be -- down at [Cair]15-cair [Paravel]16-paravel there are four thrones and it 's a saying in [Narnia]7-narnia time out of mind that when [two Sons of [Adam]48-adam]1322-two sons of adam and [two Daughters of Eve]1323-two daughters of eve sit in those four thrones , then it will be the end not only of [the White Witch]1261-the white witch 's reign but of [her]1280-the witch life , and that is why [we]1573-we had to be so cautious as [we]1573-we came along , for if [she]1280-the witch knew about [you]487-all the children four , [your]487-all the children lives would n't be worth a shake of [my]71-mr. beaver whiskers ! "[71-mr. beaver]

[All the children]487-all the children had been attending so hard to what [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver was telling [them]487-all the children that [they]487-all the children had noticed nothing else for a long time . Then during the moment of silence that followed [his]71-mr. beaver last remark , [Lucy]60-lucy suddenly said :

" [I]60-lucy say -- where 's [Edmund]36-edmund ? "[60-lucy]

There was a dreadful pause , and then [everyone]153-everyone began asking " Who saw [him]36-edmund last ? How long has [he]36-edmund been missing ? Is [he]36-edmund outside ? "[153-everyone] And then [all]1492-all rushed to the door and looked out . The snow was falling thickly and steadily , the green ice of the pool had vanished under a thick white blanket , and from where [the little house]490-the little house stood in the centre of [the dam]436-the dam [you]492-you could hardly see either bank . Out [they]487-all the children went , plunging well over [their]487-all the children ankles into the soft new snow , and went round [the house]1228-the house in every direction . " [Edmund]36-edmund ! [Edmund]36-edmund ! "[487-all the children] [they]487-all the children called till [they]487-all the children were hoarse . But the silently falling snow seemed to muffle [their]487-all the children voices and there was not even an echo in answer .

" How perfectly dreadful ! "[40-susan] said [Susan]40-susan as [they]487-all the children at last came back in despair . " Oh , how [I]40-susan wish [we]487-all the children 'd never come . "[40-susan]

" What on earth are [we]487-all the children to do , [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver ? "[38-peter] said [Peter]38-peter .

" Do ? "[71-mr. beaver] said [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver who was already putting on [his]71-mr. beaver snow boots , " do ? [We]487-all the children must be off at once . [We]487-all the children have n't a moment to spare ! "[71-mr. beaver]

" [We]487-all the children 'd better divide into four search parties , "[38-peter] said [Peter]38-peter , " and all go in different directions . Whoever finds [him]36-edmund must come back here at once and-- "[38-peter]

" Search parties , [Son of [Adam]48-adam]1320-son of adam ? "[71-mr. beaver] said [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver ; " what for ? "[71-mr. beaver]

" Why , to look for [Edmund]36-edmund of course ! "[71-mr. beaver]

" There 's no point in looking for [him]36-edmund , "[71-mr. beaver] said [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver .

" What do [you]71-mr. beaver mean ? "[40-susan] said [Susan]40-susan , " [he]36-edmund ca n't be far away yet . And [we]487-all the children 've got to find [him]36-edmund . What do [you]71-mr. beaver mean when [you]71-mr. beaver say there 's no use looking for [him]36-edmund ? "[40-susan]

" The reason there 's no use looking , "[71-mr. beaver] said [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver , " is that [we]487-all the children know already where [he]36-edmund 's gone ! "[71-mr. beaver] [Everyone]153-everyone stared in amazement . " Do n't [you]71-mr. beaver understand ? "[71-mr. beaver] said [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver . " [He]36-edmund 's gone to _ [her]1575-her _ , to [the White Witch]1261-the white witch . [He]36-edmund has betrayed [us]487-all the children all . "[71-mr. beaver]

" Oh surely -- oh really ! "[40-susan] said [Susan]40-susan , " [he]36-edmund ca n't have done that . "[40-susan]

" Ca n't [he]36-edmund ? "[71-mr. beaver] said [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver looking very hard at [the three children]495-the three children , and everything [they]495-the three children wanted to say died on [their]495-the three children lips for [each]373-each felt suddenly quite certain inside that this was exactly what [Edmund]36-edmund had done .

" But will [he]36-edmund know the way ? "[38-peter] said [Peter]38-peter .

" Has [he]36-edmund been in [this country]1414-this country before ? "[71-mr. beaver] asked [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver , " has [he]36-edmund ever been here alone ? "[71-mr. beaver]

" Yes , "[60-lucy] said [Lucy]60-lucy almost in a whisper , " [I]60-lucy 'm afraid [he]36-edmund has . "[60-lucy]

" And did [he]36-edmund tell [you]60-lucy what [he]36-edmund 'd done or who [he]36-edmund 'd met ? "[71-mr. beaver]

" Well , no , [he]36-edmund did n't , "[38-peter] said [Peter]38-peter .

" Then mark [my]71-mr. beaver words , "[71-mr. beaver] said [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver , " [he]36-edmund has already met [the White Witch]1261-the white witch and joined [her]1261-the white witch side , and been told where [she]1261-the white witch lives . [I]71-mr. beaver did n't like to mention it before ( [he]36-edmund being [[your]60-lucy brother]1326-your brother and all ) but the moment [I]71-mr. beaver set eyes on [that brother of yours]1580-that brother of yours [I]71-mr. beaver said to [myself]71-mr. beaver ' [Treacherous]78-treacherous . ' [He]36-edmund had the look of [one who has been with [the Witch]1280-the witch and eaten [her]1261-the white witch food]1581-one who has been with the witch and eaten her food . [You]60-lucy can always tell [them]1583-them if [you]60-lucy 've lived long in [Narnia]7-narnia , something about [their]1583-them eyes . "[71-mr. beaver]

" All the same , "[38-peter] said [Peter]38-peter in a rather choking sort of voice , " [we]1584-we 'll still have to go and look for [him]36-edmund . [He]36-edmund is [[our]1584-we brother]1585-our brother after all , even if [he]36-edmund is rather a little beast , and [he]36-edmund 's only [a kid]1586-a kid . "[38-peter]

" Go to [[the Witch]1280-the witch 's house]1588-the witch 's house ? "[73-mrs. beaver] said [Mrs. Beaver]73-mrs. beaver . " Do n't [you]60-lucy see that the only chance of saving either [him]36-edmund or [yourselves]60-lucy is to keep away from [her]1280-the witch ? "[73-mrs. beaver]

" How do [you]38-peter mean ? "[60-lucy] said [Lucy]60-lucy .

" Why all [she]1280-the witch wants is to get all four of [you]60-lucy ( [she]1280-the witch 's thinking all the time of those four thrones at [Cair Paravel]8-cair paravel ) . Once [you]60-lucy were all four inside [[her]1280-the witch house]1512-her house [her]1280-the witch job would be done -- and there 'd be four new statues in [her]1280-the witch collection before [you]60-lucy 'd had time to speak . But [she]1280-the witch 'll keep [him]36-edmund alive as long as [he]36-edmund 's the only one [she]1280-the witch 's got , because [she]1280-the witch 'll want to use [him]36-edmund as [a decoy]1590-a decoy ; as bait to catch the rest of [you]60-lucy with . "[38-peter]

" Oh , can _ [no _ one]1591-no _ one help [us]1592-we ? "[60-lucy] wailed [Lucy]60-lucy .

" Only [Aslan]72-aslan , "[71-mr. beaver] said [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver , " [we]1592-we must go on and meet [him]72-aslan . That 's [our]1592-we only chance now . "[71-mr. beaver]

" It seems to [me]73-mrs. beaver , [[my]73-mrs. beaver dears]1593-my dears , "[73-mrs. beaver] said [Mrs. Beaver]73-mrs. beaver , " that it is very important to know just _ when _ [he]72-aslan slipped away . How much [he]72-aslan can tell [her]1280-the witch depends on how much [he]72-aslan heard . For instance , had [we]1592-we started talking of [Aslan]72-aslan before [he]72-aslan left ? If not , then [we]1592-we may do very well , for [she]1280-the witch wo n't know that [Aslan]72-aslan has come to [Narnia]7-narnia , or that [we]1592-we are meeting [him]72-aslan and will be quite off [her]1280-the witch guard as far as _ that _ is concerned . "[73-mrs. beaver]

" [I]38-peter do n't remember [his]72-aslan being here when [we]1592-we were talking about [Aslan--]79-aslan-- "[38-peter] began [Peter]38-peter , but [Lucy]60-lucy interrupted [him]38-peter .

" Oh yes , [he]72-aslan was , "[60-lucy] [she]60-lucy said miserably ; " do n't [you]38-peter remember , it was [he]72-aslan who asked whether [the Witch]1280-the witch could n't turn [Aslan]72-aslan into stone too ? "[60-lucy]

" So [he]72-aslan did , by [Jove]80-jove , "[38-peter] said [Peter]38-peter , " just the sort of thing [he]72-aslan would say , too ! "[38-peter]

" Worse and worse , "[71-mr. beaver] said [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver , " and the next thing is this . Was [he]72-aslan still here when [I]71-mr. beaver told [you]38-peter that [the place for meeting [Aslan]72-aslan]1595-the place for meeting aslan was [the Stone Table]1545-the stone table ? "[71-mr. beaver]

And of course [no one]1221-no one knew the answer to this question .

" Because , if [he]72-aslan was , "[71-mr. beaver] continued [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver , " then [she]1280-the witch 'll simply sledge down in that direction and get between [us]1597-us and [the Stone Table]1545-the stone table and catch [us]1597-us on [our]1597-us way down . In fact [we]1597-us shall be cut off from [Aslan]72-aslan . "[71-mr. beaver]

" But that is n't what [she]1280-the witch 'll do first , "[73-mrs. beaver] said [Mrs. Beaver]73-mrs. beaver , " not if [I]73-mrs. beaver know [her]1280-the witch . The moment that [Edmund]36-edmund tells [her]1280-the witch that [we]1597-us 're all [here]1219-here [she]1280-the witch 'll set out to catch [us]1597-us this very night , and if [he]36-edmund 's been gone about half an hour , [she]1280-the witch 'll be here in about another twenty minutes . "[73-mrs. beaver]

" [You]73-mrs. beaver 're right , [Mrs. Beaver]73-mrs. beaver , "[486-her husband] said [[her]73-mrs. beaver husband]486-her husband , " [we]1597-us must all get away from here . There 's not a moment to lose . "[486-her husband]

CHAPTER IX

_ In [the Witch 's House]1588-the witch 's house _

And now of course [you]500-you want to know what had happened to [Edmund]36-edmund . [He]36-edmund had eaten [his]36-edmund share of the dinner , but [he]36-edmund had n't really enjoyed it because [he]36-edmund was thinking all the time about [Turkish Delight]58-turkish delight -- and there 's nothing that spoils the taste of good ordinary food half so much as the memory of bad magic food . And [he]36-edmund had heard the conversation and had n't enjoyed it much either , because [he]36-edmund kept on thinking that [the others]1252-the others were taking no notice of [him]36-edmund and trying to give [him]36-edmund the cold shoulder . [They]1252-the others were n't , but [he]36-edmund imagined it . And then [he]36-edmund had listened until [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver told [them]1252-the others about [Aslan]72-aslan and until [he]36-edmund had heard the whole arrangement for meeting [Aslan]72-aslan at the Stone Table . It was then that [he]36-edmund began very quietly to edge [himself]36-edmund under the curtain which hung over the door . For the mention of [Aslan]72-aslan gave [him]36-edmund a mysterious and horrible feeling just as it gave [the others]1252-the others a mysterious and lovely feeling .

Just as [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver had been repeating the rhyme about _ [Adam]48-adam 's flesh and [Adam]48-adam 's bone _ [Edmund]36-edmund had been very quietly turning the door handle ; and just before [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver had begun telling [them]1252-the others that [the White Witch]1261-the white witch was n't really human at all but [half a Jinn and half a giantess]504-half a jinn and half a giantess , [Edmund]36-edmund had got outside into the snow and cautiously closed the door behind [him]36-edmund .

[You]505-you must n't think that even now [Edmund]36-edmund was quite so bad that [he]36-edmund actually wanted [[his]36-edmund brother]285-his brother and [sisters]507-sisters to be turned into stone . [He]36-edmund did want [Turkish Delight]58-turkish delight and to be [a Prince]1336-a prince ( and later [a King]448-a king ) and to pay [Peter]38-peter out for calling [him]36-edmund [a beast]510-a beast . As for what [the Witch]1280-the witch would do with [the others]1252-the others , [he]36-edmund did n't want [her]1280-the witch to be particularly nice to [them]1252-the others -- certainly not to put [them]1252-the others on the same level as [himself]36-edmund -- but [he]36-edmund managed to believe , or to pretend [he]36-edmund believed , that [she]1280-the witch would n't do anything very bad to [them]1252-the others , " Because , "[36-edmund] [he]36-edmund said to [himself]36-edmund , " [all these people who say nasty things about [her]1280-the witch]1600-all these people who say nasty things about her are [[her]1280-the witch enemies]1601-her enemies and probably half of it is n't true . [She]1280-the witch was jolly nice to [me]36-edmund , anyway , much nicer than [they]1600-all these people who say nasty things about her are . [I]36-edmund expect [she]1280-the witch is [the rightful Queen]1602-the rightful queen really . Anyway , [she]1280-the witch 'll be better than that awful [Aslan]72-aslan ! "[36-edmund] At least , that was the excuse [he]36-edmund made in [his]36-edmund own mind for what [he]36-edmund was doing . It was n't a very good excuse , however , for deep down inside [him]36-edmund [he]36-edmund really knew that [the White Witch]59-the witch was bad and cruel .

The first thing [he]36-edmund realised when [he]36-edmund got outside and found the snow falling all around [him]36-edmund , was that [he]36-edmund had left [his]36-edmund coat behind in [[the Beavers]37-the beavers ' house]470-the beavers ' house . And of course there was no chance of going back to get it now . The next thing [he]36-edmund realised was that the daylight was almost gone , for it had been nearly three o'clock when [they]514-they sat down to dinner and the winter days were short . [He]36-edmund had n't reckoned on this ; but [he]36-edmund had to make the best of it . So [he]36-edmund turned up [his]36-edmund collar and shuffled across [the top of [the dam]436-the dam]449-the top of the dam ( luckily it was n't so slippery since the snow had fallen ) to [the far side of [the river]1361-the river]517-the far side of the river .

It was pretty bad when [he]36-edmund reached [the far side]519-the far side . It was growing darker every minute and what with that and the snowflakes swirling all round [him]36-edmund [he]36-edmund could hardly see three feet ahead . And then too there was [no road]520-no road . [He]36-edmund kept slipping into deep drifts of snow , and skidding on frozen puddles , and tripping over fallen tree - trunks , and sliding down steep banks , and barking [his]36-edmund shins against rocks , till [he]36-edmund was wet and cold and bruised all over . The silence and the loneliness were dreadful . In fact [I]0-i really think [he]36-edmund might have given up the whole plan and gone back and owned up and made [friends]305-friends with [the others]1252-the others , if [he]36-edmund had n't happened to say to [himself]36-edmund , " When [I]36-edmund 'm [King of [Narnia]7-narnia]1337-king of narnia the first thing [I]36-edmund shall do will be to make [some decent roads]1604-some decent roads . "[36-edmund] And of course that set [him]36-edmund off thinking about being [a King]448-a king and all the other things [he]36-edmund would do and this cheered [him]36-edmund up a good deal . [He]36-edmund had just settled in [his]36-edmund mind what sort of palace [he]36-edmund would have and how many [cars]524-cars and all about [[his]36-edmund private cinema]525-his private cinema and where [the principal railways]526-the principal railways would run and what laws [he]36-edmund would make against beavers and [dams]527-dams and was putting the finishing touches to some schemes for keeping [Peter]38-peter in [his]36-edmund place , when the weather changed . First the snow stopped . Then a wind sprang up and it became freezing cold . Finally , the clouds rolled away and the moon came out . It was a full moon and , shining on all that snow , it made everything almost as bright as day -- only the shadows were rather confusing .

[He]36-edmund would never have found [his]36-edmund way if the moon had n't come out by the time [he]36-edmund got to [the other river]528-the other river -- [you]529-you remember [he]36-edmund had seen ( when [they]530-they first arrived at [the Beavers]37-the beavers ' ) [a smaller river flowing into [the great one lower down]532-the great one lower down]531-a smaller river flowing into the great one lower down . [He]36-edmund now reached this and turned to follow it up . But [the little valley]381-the little valley down which it came was much steeper and rockier than [the one [he]36-edmund had just left and much overgrown with bushes]534-the one he had just left and much overgrown with bushes , so that [he]36-edmund could not have managed [it]381-the little valley at all in the dark . Even as it was , [he]36-edmund got wet through for [he]36-edmund had to stoop to go under branches and great loads of snow came sliding off on to [his]36-edmund back . And every time this happened [he]36-edmund thought more and more how [he]36-edmund hated [Peter]38-peter -- just as if all this had been [Peter]38-peter 's fault .

But at last [he]36-edmund came to a part where [it]535-it was more level and [the valley]536-the valley opened out . And there , on [the other side of [the river]1361-the river]537-the other side of the river , quite close to [him]36-edmund , in [the middle of [a little plain between two hills]540-a little plain between two hills]539-the middle of a little plain between two hills , [he]36-edmund saw what must be [the White Witch 's house]541-the white witch 's house . And the moon was shining brighter than ever . [The house]1228-the house was really [a small castle]543-a small castle . [It]1228-the house seemed to be all towers ; little towers with long pointed spires on [them]1228-the house , sharp as needles . They looked like huge dunce 's caps or [sorcerer]544-sorcerer 's caps . And they shone in the moonlight and their long shadows looked strange on the snow ! [Edmund]36-edmund began to be afraid of [the house]1228-the house .

But it was too late to think of turning back now . [He]36-edmund crossed [the river]1361-the river on the ice and walked up to [the house]1228-the house . There was nothing stirring ; not the slightest sound anywhere . Even [his]36-edmund own feet made no noise on the deep newly fallen snow . [He]36-edmund walked on and on , past corner after corner of [the house]1228-the house , and past turret after [turret]549-turret to find the door . [He]36-edmund had to go right round to the far side before [he]36-edmund found [it]550-it . It was a huge arch but the great iron gates stood wide open .

[Edmund]36-edmund crept up to the arch and looked inside into [the courtyard]1514-the courtyard , and there [he]36-edmund saw a sight that nearly made [his]36-edmund heart stop beating . Just inside the gate , with the moonlight shining on it , stood an enormous lion crouched as if it was ready to spring . And [Edmund]36-edmund stood in the shadow of the arch , afraid to go on and afraid to go back , with [his]36-edmund knees knocking together . [He]36-edmund stood there so long that [his]36-edmund teeth would have been chattering with cold even if they had not been chattering with fear . How long this really lasted [I]0-i do n't know , but it seemed to [Edmund]36-edmund to last for hours .

Then at last [he]36-edmund began to wonder why the lion was standing so still -- for it had n't moved one inch since [he]36-edmund first set eyes on it . [Edmund]36-edmund now ventured a little nearer , still keeping in the shadow of the arch as much as [he]36-edmund could . [He]36-edmund now saw from the way the lion was standing that it could n't have been looking at [him]36-edmund at all . ( " But supposing it turns its head ? "[36-edmund] thought [Edmund]36-edmund . ) In fact it was staring at something else -- namely [a little dwarf who stood with [his]552-a little dwarf who stood with his back to it about four feet away back to it about four feet away]552-a little dwarf who stood with his back to it about four feet away . " Aha ! "[36-edmund] thought [Edmund]36-edmund . " When it springs at [the dwarf]263-the dwarf then will be [my]36-edmund chance to escape . "[36-edmund] But still the lion never moved , nor did [the dwarf]263-the dwarf . And now at last [Edmund]36-edmund remembered what [the others]1252-the others had said about [the White Witch]1261-the white witch turning [people]1289-people into stone . Perhaps this was only a stone lion . And as soon as [he]36-edmund had thought of that [he]36-edmund noticed that the lion 's back and the top of its head were covered with snow . Of course it must be only [a statue]557-a statue ! No living animal would have let itself get covered with snow . Then very slowly and with [his]36-edmund heart beating as if it would burst , [Edmund]36-edmund ventured to go up to the lion . Even now [he]36-edmund hardly dared to touch it , but at last [he]36-edmund put out [his]36-edmund hand , very quickly , and did . It was cold stone . [He]36-edmund had been frightened of a mere statue !

The relief which [Edmund]36-edmund felt was so great that in spite of the cold [he]36-edmund suddenly got warm all over right down to [his]36-edmund toes , and at the same time there came into [his]36-edmund head what seemed a perfectly lovely idea . " Probably , "[36-edmund] [he]36-edmund thought , " this is the great [Lion Aslan]72-aslan that [they]1606-they were all talking about . [She]1607-she 's caught [him]72-aslan already and turned [him]72-aslan into stone . So _ that 's _ the end of all [their]1606-they fine ideas about [him]72-aslan ! Pooh ! Who 's afraid of [Aslan]72-aslan ? "[36-edmund]

And [he]36-edmund stood there gloating over the stone lion , and presently [he]36-edmund did something very silly and childish . [He]36-edmund took a stump of lead pencil out of [his]36-edmund pocket and scribbled a moustache on the lion 's upper lip and then a pair of spectacles on its eyes . Then [he]36-edmund said , " Yah ! [Silly old Aslan]72-aslan ! How do [you]72-aslan like being a stone ? [You]72-aslan thought [yourself]72-aslan mighty fine , did n't [you]72-aslan ? "[36-edmund] But in spite of the scribbles on it the face of the great stone beast still looked so terrible , and sad , and noble , staring up in the moonlight that [Edmund]36-edmund did n't really get any fun out of jeering at it . [He]36-edmund turned away and began to cross [the courtyard]1514-the courtyard .

As [he]36-edmund got into the middle of [it]1514-the courtyard [he]36-edmund saw that there were dozens of statues all about -- standing here and there rather as the pieces stand on a chess board when it is half way through the game . There were [stone satyrs]559-stone satyrs , and stone wolves , and bears and foxes and cat - a - mountains of stone . There were lovely stone shapes that looked like [women]560-women but who were really [the spirits of trees]561-the spirits of trees . There was the great shape of a centaur and a winged horse and a long lithe creature that [Edmund]36-edmund took to be a dragon . [They]562-they all looked so strange standing there perfectly lifelike and also perfectly still , in the bright cold moonlight , that it was eerie work crossing [the courtyard]1514-the courtyard . Right in the very middle stood a huge shape like [a man]177-a man , but as tall as a tree , with a fierce face and a shaggy beard and a great club in its right hand . Even though [he]36-edmund knew that it was only [a stone giant]565-a stone giant and not [a live one]566-a live one , [Edmund]36-edmund did not like going past [it]565-a stone giant .

[He]36-edmund now saw that there was a dim light showing from a doorway on the far side of [the courtyard]1514-the courtyard . [He]36-edmund went to [it]565-a stone giant , there was a flight of stone steps going up to an open door . [Edmund]36-edmund went up [them]568-them . Across the threshold lay [a great wolf]569-a great wolf :

" It 's all right , it 's all right , "[36-edmund] [he]36-edmund kept saying to [himself]36-edmund , " it 's only a stone wolf . It ca n't hurt [me]36-edmund , "[36-edmund] and [he]36-edmund raised [his]36-edmund leg to step over it . Instantly the huge creature rose , with all the hair bristling along its back , opened a great , red mouth and said in a growling voice ,

" Who 's there ? Who 's there ? Stand still , [stranger]1608-stranger , and tell [me]569-a great wolf who [you]1608-stranger are . "[569-a great wolf]

" If [you]1608-stranger please , [Sir]1405-sir , "[36-edmund] said [Edmund]36-edmund , trembling so that [he]36-edmund could hardly speak , " [my]36-edmund name is [Edmund]36-edmund , and [I]36-edmund 'm [the Son of [Adam]81-adam that [Her]1610-her Majesty]81-adam met in [the wood]1273-the wood the other day and [I]36-edmund 've come to bring [her]1610-her the news that [[my]36-edmund brother]1612-my brother and [sisters]507-sisters are now in [Narnia]7-narnia -- quite close , in [[the Beavers]37-the beavers ' house]470-the beavers ' house . [She]1610-her -- [she]1610-her wanted to see [them]1615-them . "[36-edmund]

" [I]82-the wolf will tell [[Her]1610-her Majesty]1616-her majesty , "[82-the wolf] said [the Wolf]82-the wolf . " Meanwhile , stand still on the threshold , as [you]36-edmund value [your]36-edmund life . "[82-the wolf] Then it vanished into [the house]1228-the house .

[Edmund]36-edmund stood and waited , [his]36-edmund fingers aching with cold and [his]36-edmund heart pounding in [his]36-edmund chest , and presently [the grey Wolf]571-the grey wolf , [Fenris Ulf]67-fenris ulf , [the Chief of [the Witch 's Secret Police]573-the witch 's secret police]572-the chief of the witch 's secret police , came bounding back and said , " Come in ! Come in ! [Fortunate favourite of [the Queen]269-the queen]1617-fortunate favourite of the queen -- or else not so fortunate . "[571-the grey wolf]

And [Edmund]36-edmund went in , taking great care not to tread on [the Wolf]82-the wolf 's paws .

[He]36-edmund found [himself]36-edmund in [a long gloomy hall]574-a long gloomy hall with many pillars , full , as [the courtyard]1514-the courtyard had been , of statues . The one nearest the door was a little Faun with a very sad expression on [its]576-its face , and [Edmund]36-edmund could n't help wondering if this might be [[Lucy]60-lucy 's friend]577-lucy 's friend . The only light came from a single lamp and close behind this sat [the White Witch]1261-the white witch .

" [I]36-edmund 'm come , [[your]1280-the witch Majesty]1300-your majesty , "[36-edmund] said [Edmund]36-edmund rushing eagerly forward .

" How dare [you]36-edmund come alone ? "[1280-the witch] said [the Witch]1280-the witch in a terrible voice . " Did [I]1280-the witch not tell [you]36-edmund to bring [the others]1252-the others with [you]36-edmund ? "[1280-the witch]

" Please , [[your]1280-the witch Majesty]1300-your majesty , "[36-edmund] said [Edmund]36-edmund , " [I]36-edmund 've done the best [I]36-edmund can . "[36-edmund]

A slow cruel smile came over [the Witch]1280-the witch 's face .

" Is this all [your]36-edmund news ? "[1280-the witch] [she]1280-the witch asked .

" No , [[your]1280-the witch Majesty]1300-your majesty , "[36-edmund] said [Edmund]36-edmund , and proceeded to tell [her]1280-the witch all [he]36-edmund had heard before leaving [[the Beavers]37-the beavers ' house]470-the beavers ' house .

" What ! [Aslan]72-aslan ? "[269-the queen] cried [the Queen]269-the queen , " [Aslan]72-aslan ! Is this true ? If [I]269-the queen find [you]36-edmund have lied to me-- "[269-the queen]

" Please , [I]36-edmund 'm only repeating what [they]37-the beavers said , "[36-edmund] stammered [Edmund]36-edmund .

CHAPTER X

_ The Spell Begins to Break _

Now [we]586-we must go back to [Mr.]587-mr. and [Mrs. Beaver]73-mrs. beaver and [the three other children]588-the three other children . As soon as [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver said " There 's no time to lose "[71-mr. beaver] [everyone]153-everyone began bundling [themselves]153-everyone into coats , except [Mrs. Beaver]73-mrs. beaver who started picking up sacks and laying them on the table and said : " Now , [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver , just reach down that ham . And here 's a packet of tea , and there 's sugar , and some matches . And if [someone]302-someone will get two or three loaves out of the crock over there in the corner . "[73-mrs. beaver]

" What are [you]71-mr. beaver doing , [Mrs. Beaver]73-mrs. beaver ? "[40-susan] exclaimed [Susan]40-susan .

" But [we]586-we have n't time ! "[40-susan] said [Susan]40-susan , buttoning the collar of [her]40-susan coat . " [She]590-his wife may be [here]1219-here any minute . "[40-susan]

" [You]40-susan 've got to remember _ that _ , [Mrs. Beaver]73-mrs. beaver , "[40-susan] said [Susan]40-susan . " As soon as [she]590-his wife has looked in [here]1219-here and finds [we]586-we 're gone [she]590-his wife 'll be off at top speed . "[40-susan]

" Then -- have [we]586-we no hope ? "[40-susan] said [Susan]40-susan .

" That 's true enough , [Mrs. Beaver]73-mrs. beaver , "[486-her husband] said [[her]73-mrs. beaver husband]486-her husband . " But it 's time [we]586-we were out of this . "[486-her husband]

" [I]73-mrs. beaver suppose the sewing machine 's too heavy to bring ? "[73-mrs. beaver]

" Oh , please , please , please , do hurry ! "[495-the three children] said [the three children]495-the three children . And so at last [they]495-the three children all got outside and [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver locked the door ( " It 'll delay [her]1635-that witch a bit , "[71-mr. beaver] [he]71-mr. beaver said ) and [they]495-the three children set off , all carrying [their]495-the three children loads over [their]495-the three children shoulders .

The snow had stopped and the moon had come out when [they]495-the three children began [their]495-the three children journey . [They]495-the three children went in single file -- first [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver , then [Lucy]60-lucy , then [Peter]38-peter , then [Susan]40-susan , and [Mrs. Beaver]73-mrs. beaver last of all . [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver led [them]495-the three children across [the dam]436-the dam and onto [the right bank of [the river]1361-the river]596-the right bank of the river and then along a very rough sort of path among the trees right down by [the river - bank]598-the river - bank . [The sides of [the valley]536-the valley]599-the sides of the valley , shining in the moonlight , towered up far above [them]495-the three children on either hand . " Best keep down here as much as possible , "[71-mr. beaver] [he]71-mr. beaver said . " [She]60-lucy 'll have to keep to the top , for [you]60-lucy could n't bring [a sledge]1381-a sledge down here . "[71-mr. beaver]

It would have been a pretty enough scene to look at [it]601-it through a window from a comfortable armchair ; and even as things were , [Lucy]60-lucy enjoyed it at first . But as [they]495-the three children went on walking and walking -- and walking -- and as the sack [she]60-lucy was carrying felt heavier and heavier , [she]60-lucy began to wonder how [she]60-lucy was going to keep up at all . And [she]60-lucy stopped looking at the dazzling brightness of [the frozen river]602-the frozen river with all [its]602-the frozen river waterfalls of ice and at the white masses of the tree - tops and the great glaring moon and the countless stars and could only watch the little short legs of [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver going pad - pad - pad - pad through the snow in front of [her]60-lucy as if [they]495-the three children were never going to stop . Then the moon disappeared and the snow began to fall once more . And at last [Lucy]60-lucy was so tired that [she]60-lucy was almost asleep and walking at the same time when suddenly [she]60-lucy found that [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver had turned away from [the river bank]603-the river bank to the right and was leading [them]495-the three children steeply uphill into the very thickest bushes . And then as [she]60-lucy came fully awake [she]60-lucy found that [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver was just vanishing into [a little hole in [the bank]605-the bank which had been almost hidden under the bushes until [you]606-you were quite on top of it]604-a little hole in the bank which had been almost hidden under the bushes until you were quite on top of it . In fact , by the time [she]60-lucy realised what was happening , only [his]71-mr. beaver short flat tail was showing .

[Lucy]60-lucy immediately stooped down and crawled in after [him]71-mr. beaver . Then [she]60-lucy heard noises of scrambling and puffing and panting behind [her]60-lucy and in a moment [all five of [them]607-all five of them]607-all five of them were inside .

" Wherever is this ? "[38-peter] said [Peter]38-peter 's voice , sounding tired and pale in the darkness . ( [I]0-i hope [you]606-you know what [I]0-i mean by a voice sounding pale . )

" It 's an old hiding - place for beavers in bad times , "[71-mr. beaver] said [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver , " and [a great secret]1637-a great secret . [It]1637-a great secret 's not much of [a place]1638-a place but [we]607-all five of them must get a few hours ' sleep . "[71-mr. beaver]

" If [you]606-you had n't all been in such a plaguey fuss when [we]607-all five of them were starting , [I]73-mrs. beaver 'd have brought some pillows , "[73-mrs. beaver] said [Mrs. Beaver]73-mrs. beaver .

It was n't nearly such [a nice cave as [Mr. Tumnus]49-mr. tumnus 's]608-a nice cave as mr. tumnus 's , [Lucy]60-lucy thought -- just a hole in the ground but dry and earthy . It was very small so that when [they]607-all five of them all lay down [they]607-all five of them were all a bundle of fur and clothes together , and what with that and being warmed up by [their]607-all five of them long walk [they]607-all five of them were really rather snug . If only the floor of [the cave]383-the cave had been a little smoother ! Then [Mrs. Beaver]73-mrs. beaver handed round in the dark a little flask out of which [everyone]153-everyone drank something -- it made one cough and splutter a little and stung the throat but it also made [you]611-you feel deliciously warm after [you]611-you 'd swallowed it -- and [everyone]153-everyone went straight to sleep .

It seemed to [Lucy]60-lucy only the next minute ( though really it was hours and hours later ) when [she]60-lucy woke up feeling a little cold and dreadfully stiff and thinking how [she]60-lucy would like a hot bath . Then [she]60-lucy felt a set of long whiskers tickling [her]60-lucy cheek and saw the cold daylight coming in through the mouth of [the cave]383-the cave . But immediately after that [she]60-lucy was very wide awake indeed , and so was [everyone else]614-everyone else . In fact [they]607-all five of them were all sitting up with [their]607-all five of them mouths and eyes wide open , listening to a sound which was the very sound [they]607-all five of them 'd all been thinking of ( and sometimes imagining [they]607-all five of them heard ) during [their]607-all five of them walk last night . It was a sound of jingling bells .

[Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver was out of [the cave]383-the cave like a flash the moment [he]71-mr. beaver heard it . Perhaps [you]611-you think , as [Lucy]60-lucy thought for a moment , that this was a very silly thing for [him]71-mr. beaver to do ? But it was really a very sensible one . [He]71-mr. beaver knew [he]71-mr. beaver could scramble to the top of [the bank]605-the bank among bushes and brambles without being seen ; and [he]71-mr. beaver wanted above all things to see which way [the Witch]1280-the witch 's sledge went . [The others]1252-the others all sat in [the cave]383-the cave waiting and wondering . [They]607-all five of them waited nearly five minutes . Then [they]607-all five of them heard something that frightened [them]607-all five of them very much . [They]607-all five of them heard voices . " Oh , "[60-lucy] thought [Lucy]60-lucy , " [he]71-mr. beaver 's been seen . [She]1280-the witch 's caught [him]71-mr. beaver ! "[60-lucy]

" It 's all right , "[71-mr. beaver] [he]71-mr. beaver was shouting . " Come out , [Mrs. Beaver]73-mrs. beaver . Come out , [Sons]1639-sons and Daughters of [Adam]81-adam and [Eve]48-adam . "[71-mr. beaver] This was bad grammar of course , but that is how beavers talk when [they]621-they are excited ; [I]0-i mean , in [Narnia]7-narnia -- in [our]622-our world [they]621-they usually do n't talk at all .

So [Mrs. Beaver]73-mrs. beaver and [the children]391-the children came bundling out of [the cave]383-the cave , all blinking in the daylight , and with earth all over [them]607-all five of them , and looking very frowsty and unbrushed and uncombed and with the sleep in [their]607-all five of them eyes .

" Come on ! "[71-mr. beaver] cried [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver , who was almost dancing with delight . " Come and see ! This is a nasty knock for [the Witch]59-the witch ! It looks as if [her]59-the witch power was already crumbling . "[71-mr. beaver]

" What _ do _ [you]71-mr. beaver mean , [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver ? "[38-peter] panted [Peter]38-peter as [they]607-all five of them all scrambled up [the steep bank of [the valley]536-the valley]625-the steep bank of the valley together .

" Did n't [I]71-mr. beaver tell [you]38-peter , "[71-mr. beaver] answered [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver , " that [she]59-the witch 'd made it always winter and never Christmas ? Did n't [I]71-mr. beaver tell [you]38-peter ? Well , just come and see ! "[71-mr. beaver]

"[62-father christmas]

[Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver was so pleased that [he]71-mr. beaver opened [his]71-mr. beaver mouth very wide and then found [he]71-mr. beaver could n't say anything at all .

" [Peter]38-peter , [[Adam]48-adam 's Son]1644-adam 's son , "[62-father christmas] said [Father Christmas]62-father christmas .

" These are [your]1405-sir presents , "[71-mr. beaver] was the answer , " and they are tools not toys . The time to use them is perhaps near at hand . Bear them well . "[71-mr. beaver] With these words [he]71-mr. beaver handed to [Peter]38-peter a shield and a sword . " [Susan]40-susan , [[Eve]48-adam 's Daughter]1646-eve 's daughter , "[62-father christmas] said [Father Christmas]62-father christmas . Last of all [he]71-mr. beaver said , " [Lucy]60-lucy , [[Eve]48-adam 's Daughter]1646-eve 's daughter , "[71-mr. beaver] and [Lucy]60-lucy came forward . " In this bottle , "[71-mr. beaver] [he]71-mr. beaver said , " there is a cordial made of the juice of one of the fire - flowers that grow in the mountains of the sun .
