" Why , [Sir]1405-sir , "[60-lucy] said [Lucy]60-lucy . " [I]60-lucy think -- [I]60-lucy do n't know -- but [I]60-lucy think [I]60-lucy could be brave enough . "[60-lucy]

" That is not the point , "[71-mr. beaver] [he]71-mr. beaver said . " But battles are ugly when [women]560-women fight . And now"--here[71-mr. beaver] [he]71-mr. beaver suddenly looked less grave--"here is something for the moment for [you]642-you all ! "[71-mr. beaver] and [he]71-mr. beaver brought out ( [I]0-i suppose from the big bag at [his]71-mr. beaver back , but [nobody]1288-nobody quite saw [him]71-mr. beaver do it ) a large tray containing five cups and saucers , a bowl of lump sugar , a jug of cream , and a great big teapot all sizzling and piping hot . Then [he]71-mr. beaver cried out " A Merry Christmas ! Long live [the true King]1651-the true king ! "[71-mr. beaver] and cracked [his]71-mr. beaver whip and [he]71-mr. beaver and the reindeer and the sledge and all were out of sight before [anyone]325-anyone realised that [they]646-they had started .

[Peter]38-peter had just drawn [his]38-peter sword out of its sheath and was showing it to [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver when [Mrs. Beaver]73-mrs. beaver said :

" Now then , now then ! Do n't stand talking there till the tea 's got cold . Just like [men]1316-men . Come and help to carry the tray down and [we]646-they 'll have breakfast . What a mercy [I]73-mrs. beaver thought of bringing the bread - knife . "[73-mrs. beaver]

So down [the steep bank]647-the steep bank [they]646-they went and back to [the cave]383-the cave , and [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver cut some of the bread and ham into sandwiches and [Mrs. Beaver]73-mrs. beaver poured out the tea and [everyone]153-everyone enjoyed [himself]71-mr. beaver . But long before [they]646-they had finished enjoying [themselves]646-they [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver said , " Time to be moving on now . "[71-mr. beaver]

CHAPTER XI

_ Aslan Is Nearer _

[Edmund]36-edmund meanwhile had been having a most disappointing time . When [the Dwarf]263-the dwarf had gone to get [the sledge]257-the sledge ready [he]36-edmund expected that [the Witch]1280-the witch would start being nice to [him]36-edmund , as [she]1280-the witch had been at [their]646-they last meeting . But [she]1280-the witch said nothing at all . And when at last [Edmund]36-edmund plucked up [his]36-edmund courage to say , " Please , [[your]1280-the witch Majesty]1300-your majesty , could [I]1280-the witch have some Turkish Delight ? [You]1280-the witch -- [you]1280-the witch -- said-- "[1280-the witch] [she]1280-the witch answered , " Silence , [fool]1654-fool ! "[1280-the witch] Then [she]1280-the witch appeared to change [her]1280-the witch mind and said , as if to [herself]1280-the witch , " And yet it will not do to have [the brat]1655-the brat fainting on the way , "[1280-the witch] and once more clapped [her]1280-the witch hands . [Another dwarf]653-another dwarf appeared . " Bring [the human creature]1656-the human creature food and drink , "[1280-the witch] [she]1280-the witch said . [The Dwarf]263-the dwarf went away and presently returned bringing an iron bowl with some water in it and an iron plate with a hunk of dry bread on it . [He]263-the dwarf grinned in a repulsive manner as [he]263-the dwarf set them down the floor beside [Edmund]36-edmund and said :

" Turkish Delight for [the little Prince]1657-the little prince . Ha ! Ha ! Ha ! "[263-the dwarf]

" Take it away , "[36-edmund] said [Edmund]36-edmund sulkily . " [I]36-edmund do n't want dry bread . "[36-edmund] But [the Witch]1280-the witch suddenly turned on [him]36-edmund with such a terrible expression on [her]1280-the witch face that [he]36-edmund apologised and began to nibble at the bread , though it was so stale [he]36-edmund could hardly get it down .

" [You]36-edmund may be glad enough of it before [you]36-edmund taste bread again , "[1280-the witch] said [the Witch]1280-the witch .

While [he]36-edmund was still chewing away [the first dwarf]657-the first dwarf came back and announced that [the sledge]257-the sledge was ready . [The White Witch]59-the witch rose and went out , ordering [Edmund]36-edmund to go with [her]59-the witch . The snow was again falling as [they]659-they came into [the courtyard]1514-the courtyard but [she]59-the witch took no notice of that and made [Edmund]36-edmund sit beside [her]59-the witch on [the sledge]257-the sledge . But before [they]659-they drove off [she]59-the witch called [Fenris Ulf]67-fenris ulf and [he]67-fenris ulf came bounding like an enormous dog to the side of [the sledge]257-the sledge .

" Take with [you]36-edmund the swiftest of [your]36-edmund wolves and go at once to [the house of [the Beavers]37-the beavers]1658-the house of the beavers , "[1280-the witch] said [the Witch]1280-the witch , " and kill whatever [you]36-edmund find there . If [they]37-the beavers are already gone , then make all speed to [the Stone Table]19-the stone table , but do not be seen . Wait for [me]1280-the witch [there]283-there in hiding . [I]1280-the witch meanwhile must go many miles to [the West]20-the west before [I]1280-the witch find [a place where [I]1280-the witch can drive across [the river]1361-the river]1660-a place where i can drive across the river . [You]36-edmund may overtake [these humans]1662-these humans before [they]1662-these humans reach [the Stone Table]19-the stone table . [You]36-edmund will know what to do if [you]36-edmund find [them]1662-these humans ! "[1280-the witch]

" [I]664-the wolf hear and obey , [O Queen]1663-o queen , "[664-the wolf] growled [the Wolf]664-the wolf ; and immediately [he]664-the wolf shot away into the snow and darkness , as quickly as a horse can gallop . In a few minutes [he]664-the wolf had called another wolf and was with [him]664-the wolf down on the dam and sniffing at [[the Beavers]37-the beavers ' house]470-the beavers ' house . But of course [they]666-they found [it]470-the beavers ' house empty . It would have been a dreadful thing for [the Beavers]37-the beavers and [the children]391-the children if the night had remained fine , for the wolves would then have been able to follow [their]666-they trail -- and ten to one would have overtaken [them]666-they before [they]666-they had got to [the cave]383-the cave . But now that the snow had begun again the scent was cold and even the footprints were covered up .

Meanwhile [the Dwarf]263-the dwarf whipped up the reindeer and [the Witch]1280-the witch and [Edmund]36-edmund drove out under [the archway]671-the archway and on and away into the darkness and the cold . This was a terrible journey for [Edmund]36-edmund who had no coat . Before [they]666-they had been going a quarter of an hour all the front of [him]36-edmund was covered with snow -- [he]36-edmund soon stopped trying to shake it off because , as quickly as [he]36-edmund did that , a new lot gathered , and [he]36-edmund was so tired . Soon [he]36-edmund was wet to the skin . And oh , how miserable [he]36-edmund was . It did n't look now as if [the Witch]1280-the witch intended to make [him]36-edmund [a King]448-a king ! All the things [he]36-edmund had said to make [himself]36-edmund believe that [she]1280-the witch was good and kind and that [her]1280-the witch side was really the right side sounded to [him]36-edmund silly now . [He]36-edmund would have given anything to meet [the others]1252-the others at this moment -- even [Peter]38-peter ! The only way to comfort [himself]36-edmund now was to try to believe that the whole thing was a dream and that [he]36-edmund might wake up at any moment . And as [they]666-they went on , hour after hour , it did come to seem like a dream .

This lasted longer than [I]0-i could describe even if [I]0-i wrote pages and pages about it . But [I]0-i will skip on to the time when the snow had stopped and the morning had come and [they]666-they were racing along in the daylight . And still [they]666-they went on and on , with no sound but the everlasting swish of the snow and the creaking of the reindeer 's harness . And then at last [the Witch]1280-the witch said , " What have [we]666-they here ? Stop ! "[1280-the witch] and [they]666-they did .

How [Edmund]36-edmund hoped [she]1280-the witch was going to say something about breakfast ! But [she]1280-the witch had stopped for quite a different reason . A little way off at the foot of a tree sat [a merry party]676-a merry party , a squirrel and [[his]677-his wife]590-his wife with [[their]666-they children]679-their children and [two satyrs]680-two satyrs and [a dwarf]681-a dwarf and an old dog - fox , all on stools round a table . [Edmund]36-edmund could n't quite see what [they]666-they were eating , but it smelled lovely and there seemed to be decorations of holly and [he]36-edmund was n't at all sure that [he]36-edmund did n't see something like a plum pudding . At the moment when [the sledge]257-the sledge stopped , the Fox , who was obviously [the oldest person present]683-the oldest person present , had just risen to [its]684-its feet , holding a glass in its right paw as if it was going to say something . But when [the whole party]685-the whole party saw [the sledge]257-the sledge stopping and who was in it , all the gaiety went out of [their]685-the whole party faces . [The father]687-the father squirrel stopped eating with [his]677-his fork half - way to [his]677-his mouth and one of [the satyrs]688-the satyrs stopped with its fork actually in its mouth , and the baby squirrels squealed with terror .

" What is the meaning of this ? "[689-the witch queen] asked [the Witch Queen]689-the witch queen . [Nobody]1288-nobody answered .

" Speak , [vermin]1664-vermin ! "[689-the witch queen] [she]689-the witch queen said again . " Or do [you]1664-vermin want [[my]689-the witch queen dwarf]1665-my dwarf to find [you]1664-vermin a tongue with [his]1665-my dwarf whip ? " Please , [[your]1664-vermin Majesty]1300-your majesty , "[83-the fox] said [the Fox]83-the fox , " [we]1667-we were given them . And if [I]83-the fox might make so bold as to drink [[your]1664-vermin Majesty]1300-your majesty 's very good health-- "[83-the fox]

" Who gave them to [you]1664-vermin ? "[1280-the witch] said [the Witch]1280-the witch .

" F - F - F - [Father Christmas]62-father christmas , "[692-the fox] stammered [the Fox]692-the fox .

" What ? "[1280-the witch] roared [the Witch]1280-the witch , springing from [the sledge]257-the sledge and taking a few strides nearer to the terrified animals . " [He]1665-my dwarf has not been [here]1219-here ! [He]1665-my dwarf can not have been [here]1219-here ! How dare [you]1664-vermin -- but no . Say [you]1664-vermin have been lying and [you]1664-vermin shall even now be forgiven . "[1280-the witch]

At that moment one of the young squirrels lost its head completely .

" [He]1665-my dwarf has -- [he]1665-my dwarf has -- [he]1665-my dwarf has ! "[1280-the witch] it squeaked beating its little spoon on the table . [Edmund]36-edmund saw [the Witch]1280-the witch bite [her]1280-the witch lips so that a drop of blood appeared on [her]1280-the witch white cheek . Then [she]1280-the witch raised [her]1280-the witch wand . " Oh do n't , do n't , please do n't , "[36-edmund] shouted [Edmund]36-edmund , but even while [he]36-edmund was shouting [she]1280-the witch had waved [her]1280-the witch wand and instantly where [the merry party]696-the merry party had been there were only statues of creatures ( one with its stone fork fixed forever half - way to its stone mouth ) seated round a stone table on which there were stone plates and a stone plum pudding .

" As for [you]36-edmund , "[1280-the witch] said [the Witch]1280-the witch , giving [Edmund]36-edmund a stunning blow on the face as [she]1280-the witch re - mounted [the sledge]257-the sledge , " let that teach [you]36-edmund to ask favour for [spies]1462-spies and [traitors]1672-traitors . Drive on ! "[1280-the witch] And [Edmund]36-edmund for the first time in this story felt sorry for [someone besides [himself]36-edmund]699-someone besides himself . It seemed so pitiful to think of [those little stone figures sitting there all the silent days]700-those little stone figures sitting there all the silent days and all the dark nights , year after year , till the moss grew on them and at last even [their]700-those little stone figures sitting there all the silent days faces crumbled away .

Now [they]700-those little stone figures sitting there all the silent days were steadily racing on again . And soon [Edmund]36-edmund noticed that the snow which splashed against [them]700-those little stone figures sitting there all the silent days as [they]700-those little stone figures sitting there all the silent days rushed through it was much wetter than it had been all last night . At the same time [he]36-edmund noticed that [he]36-edmund was feeling much less cold . It was also becoming foggy . In fact every minute it grew both foggier and warmer . And [the sledge]257-the sledge was not running nearly as well as it had been running up till now . At first [he]36-edmund thought this was because [the reindeer]702-the reindeer were tired , but soon [he]36-edmund saw that that could n't be the real reason . [The sledge]257-the sledge jerked , and skidded , and kept on jolting as if it had struck against stones . And however [the Dwarf]263-the dwarf whipped [the poor reindeer]705-the poor reindeer the sledge went slower and slower . There also seemed to be a curious noise all round [them]700-those little stone figures sitting there all the silent days but the noise of [their]700-those little stone figures sitting there all the silent days driving and jolting and [the Dwarf]263-the dwarf 's shouting at [the reindeer]702-the reindeer prevented [Edmund]36-edmund from hearing what it was , until suddenly the sledge stuck so fast that it would n't go on at all . When that happened there was a moment 's silence . And in that silence [Edmund]36-edmund could at last listen to the other noise properly . A strange , sweet , rustling , chattering noise -- and yet not so strange , for [he]36-edmund knew [he]36-edmund 'd heard it before -- if only [he]36-edmund could remember where ! Then all at once [he]36-edmund did remember . It was the noise of running water . All round [them]700-those little stone figures sitting there all the silent days , though out of sight , there were streams chattering , murmuring , bubbling , splashing and even ( in the distance ) roaring . And [his]36-edmund heart gave a great leap ( though [he]36-edmund hardly knew why ) when [he]36-edmund realised that the frost was over . And much nearer there was a drip - drip - drip from the branches of all the trees . And then , as [he]36-edmund looked at one tree [he]36-edmund saw a great load of snow slide off it and for the first time since [he]36-edmund had entered [Narnia]7-narnia [he]36-edmund saw the dark green of a fir tree . But [he]36-edmund had n't time to listen or watch any longer for [the Witch]1280-the witch said :

" Do n't sit staring , [fool]1654-fool ! Get out and help . "[1280-the witch]

And of course [Edmund]36-edmund had to obey . [He]36-edmund stepped out into the snow -- but it was really only slush by now -- and began helping [the Dwarf]263-the dwarf to get the sledge out of [the muddy hole it had got into]710-the muddy hole it had got into . [They]711-we got it out in the end , and by being very cruel to [the reindeer]702-the reindeer [the Dwarf]263-the dwarf managed to get it on the move again , and [they]711-we drove a little further . And now the snow was really melting in earnest and patches of green grass were beginning to appear in every direction . Unless [you]714-you have looked at [a world of snow]715-a world of snow as long as [Edmund]36-edmund had been looking at it , [you]714-you will hardly be able to imagine what a relief those green patches were after the endless white . Then the sledge stopped again .

" It 's no good , [[your]59-the witch Majesty]1300-your majesty , "[263-the dwarf] said [the Dwarf]263-the dwarf . " [We]711-we ca n't sledge in this thaw . "[263-the dwarf]

" Then [we]711-we must walk , "[59-the witch] said [the Witch]59-the witch .

" [We]711-we shall never overtake [them]702-the reindeer walking , "[263-the dwarf] growled [the dwarf]263-the dwarf . " Not with the start [they]702-the reindeer 've got . "[263-the dwarf]

" Are [you]263-the dwarf [[my]1280-the witch councillor]1675-my councillor or [[my]1280-the witch slave]1676-my slave ? "[1280-the witch] said [the Witch]1280-the witch . " Do as [you]263-the dwarf 're told . Tie the hands of [the human creature]1656-the human creature behind it and keep hold of the end of the rope . And take [your]263-the dwarf whip . And cut the harness of the reindeer ; [they]702-the reindeer 'll find [their]702-the reindeer own way [home]1250-home . "[1280-the witch]

[The Dwarf]263-the dwarf obeyed , and in a few minutes [Edmund]36-edmund found [himself]36-edmund being forced to walk as fast as [he]36-edmund could with [his]36-edmund hands tied behind [him]36-edmund . [He]36-edmund kept on slipping in the slush and mud and wet grass , and every time [he]36-edmund slipped [the Dwarf]263-the dwarf gave [him]36-edmund a curse and sometimes a flick with the whip . [The Witch]1280-the witch walked behind [the dwarf]263-the dwarf and kept on saying , " Faster ! Faster ! "[1280-the witch]

Every moment the patches of green grew bigger and the patches of snow grew smaller . Every moment more and more of the trees shook off [their]723-their robes of snow . Soon , wherever [you]724-you looked , instead of white shapes [you]724-you saw the dark green of firs or the black prickly branches of bare oaks and beeches and elms . Then the mist turned from white to gold and presently cleared away altogether . Shafts of delicious sunlight struck down onto the forest floor and overhead [you]724-you could see a blue sky between the tree - tops .

Soon there were more wonderful things happening . Coming suddenly round a corner into [a glade of silver birch trees]725-a glade of silver birch trees [Edmund]36-edmund saw the ground covered in all directions with little yellow flowers -- celandines . The noise of water grew louder . Presently [they]726-they actually crossed [a stream]727-a stream . Beyond it [they]726-they found snowdrops growing .

" Mind [your]36-edmund own business ! "[263-the dwarf] said [the Dwarf]263-the dwarf when [he]263-the dwarf saw that [Edmund]36-edmund had turned [his]36-edmund head to look at [them]726-they ; and [he]263-the dwarf gave the rope a vicious jerk .

But of course this did n't prevent [Edmund]36-edmund from seeing . Only five minutes later [he]36-edmund noticed a dozen crocuses growing round the foot of an old tree -- gold and purple and white . Then came a sound even more delicious than the sound of the water . Close beside the path [they]726-they were following a bird suddenly chirped from the branch of a tree . It was answered by the chuckle of another bird a little further off . And then , as if that had been a signal , there was chattering and chirruping in every direction , and then a moment of full song , and within five minutes the whole wood was ringing with birds ' music , and wherever [Edmund]36-edmund 's eyes turned [he]36-edmund saw birds alighting on branches , or sailing overhead or having [their]729-their little quarrels .

" Faster ! Faster ! "[1280-the witch] said [the Witch]1280-the witch .

There was no trace of the fog now . The sky became bluer and bluer and now there were white clouds hurrying across it from time to time . In [the wide glades]731-the wide glades there were primroses . A light breeze sprang up which scattered drops of moisture from the swaying branches and carried cool , delicious scents against the faces of [the travellers]732-the travellers . The trees began to come fully alive . The larches and birches were covered with green , the laburnums with gold . Soon the beech trees had put forth their delicate , transparent leaves . As [the travellers]732-the travellers walked under [them]726-they the light also became green . A bee buzzed across [their]726-they path .

" This is no thaw , "[263-the dwarf] said [the Dwarf]263-the dwarf , suddenly stopping . " This is _ spring _ . What are [we]726-they to do ? [Your]36-edmund winter has been destroyed , [I]263-the dwarf tell [you]36-edmund ! This is [Aslan]72-aslan 's doing . "[263-the dwarf]

" If either of [you]36-edmund mention that name again , "[1280-the witch] said [the Witch]1280-the witch , " [he]72-aslan shall instantly be killed . "[1280-the witch]

CHAPTER XII

_ [Peter]38-peter 's First Battle _

While [the Dwarf]263-the dwarf and [the White Witch]1261-the white witch were saying this , miles away [the Beaver]71-mr. beaver and [the children]391-the children were walking on hour after hour into what seemed a delicious dream . Long ago [they]726-they had left the coats behind [them]726-they . And by now [they]726-they had even stopped saying to [one another]186-one another , " Look ! There 's [a kingfisher]1679-a kingfisher ! "[726-they] or " [I]726-they say , bluebells ! "[726-they] or " What was that lovely smell ? "[726-they] or " Just listen to that thrush ! "[726-they] [They]726-they walked on in silence drinking it all in , passing through patches of warm sunlight into cool , green thickets and out again into wide mossy glades where tall elms raised the leafy roof far overhead , and then into dense masses of flowering currant and among hawthorn bushes where the sweet smell was almost overpowering .

[They]726-they had been just as surprised as [Edmund]36-edmund when [they]726-they saw the winter vanishing and the whole wood passing in a few hours or so from January to May. [They]726-they had n't even known for certain ( as [the Witch]1280-the witch did ) that this was what would happen when [Aslan]72-aslan came to [Narnia]7-narnia . But [they]726-they all knew that it was [her]1280-the witch spells which had produced the endless winter ; and therefore [they]726-they all knew when this magic spring began that something had gone wrong , and badly wrong , with [the Witch]1280-the witch 's schemes . And after the thaw had been going on for some time [they]726-they all realised that [the Witch]59-the witch would no longer be able to use [her]59-the witch sledge . After that [they]726-they did n't hurry so much and [they]726-they allowed [themselves]726-they more rests and longer ones . [They]726-they were pretty tired by now of course ; but not what [I]0-i 'd call bitterly tired -- only slow and feeling very dreamy and quiet inside as one does when one is coming to the end of a long day in the open . [Susan]40-susan had a slight blister on one heel .

[They]726-they had left the course of [the big river]742-the big river some time ago ; for [one]1408-one had to turn a little to the right ( that meant a little to [the South]21-the south ) to reach [the place of the Stone Table]744-the place of the stone table . Even if this had not been [their]726-they way , [they]726-they could n't have kept to [the river valley]745-the river valley once the thaw began , for with all that melting snow [the river]1361-the river was soon in flood -- a wonderful , roaring , thundering yellow flood -- and [their]726-they path would have been under water .

And now the sun got low and the light got redder and the shadows got longer and the flowers began to think about closing .

" Not long now , "[71-mr. beaver] said [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver , and began leading [them]726-they uphill across some very deep , springy moss ( it felt nice under [their]726-they tired feet ) in a place where only tall trees grew , very wide apart . The climb , coming at the end of the long day , made [them]726-they all pant and blow . And just as [Lucy]60-lucy was wondering whether [she]60-lucy could really get to the top without another long rest , suddenly [they]726-they _ were _ at the top . And this is what [they]726-they saw .

[They]726-they were on [a green open space from which [you]748-you could look down on [the forest]202-the forest spreading as far as [one]1408-one could see in every direction]747-a green open space from which you could look down on the forest spreading as far as one could see in every direction -- except right ahead . There , far to [the East]751-the east , was something twinkling and moving . " By gum ! "[38-peter] whispered [Peter]38-peter to [Susan]40-susan . " [The sea]1565-the sea ! "[38-peter] In the very middle of [this open hilltop]752-this open hilltop was the Stone Table . It was a great grim slab of grey stone supported on four upright stones . [It]753-it looked very old ; and it was cut all over with strange lines and figures that might be the letters of an unknown language . They gave [you]748-you a curious feeling when [you]748-you looked at [them]753-it . The next thing [they]726-they saw was [a pavilion]754-a pavilion pitched on one side of [the open place]755-the open place . [A wonderful pavilion]756-a wonderful pavilion [it]756-a wonderful pavilion was -- and especially now when the light of the setting sun fell upon [it]756-a wonderful pavilion -- with sides of what looked like yellow silk and cords of crimson and tent - pegs of ivory ; and high above it on a pole a banner , which bore a red rampant lion , fluttered in the breeze which was blowing in [their]726-they faces from [the far - off sea]757-the far - off sea . While [they]726-they were looking at this [they]726-they heard a sound of music on [their]726-they right ; and turning in that direction [they]726-they saw what [they]726-they had come to see .

[Aslan]72-aslan stood in the centre of [a crowd of creatures who had grouped [themselves]758-a crowd of creatures who had grouped themselves around him in the shape of a half - moon around [him]72-aslan in the shape of a half - moon]758-a crowd of creatures who had grouped themselves around him in the shape of a half - moon . There were Tree - Women there and [Well - Women ( [Dryads]84-dryads and [Naiads]85-naiads as [they]759-well - women ( dryads and naiads as they used to be called in our world used to be called in [[our]760-our world]636-our world]759-well - women ( dryads and naiads as they used to be called in our world ) who had stringed instruments ; it was [they]759-well - women ( dryads and naiads as they used to be called in our world who had made the music . There were four great centaurs . The horse part of [them]762-them was like huge English farm horses , and [the man]763-the man part was like [stern but beautiful giants]764-stern but beautiful giants . There was also a unicorn , and a bull with the head of [a man]177-a man , and a pelican , and an eagle , and a great dog . And next to [Aslan]72-aslan stood two leopards of whom one carried [his]72-aslan crown and the other [his]72-aslan standard .

But as for [Aslan]72-aslan [himself]72-aslan , [the Beavers]37-the beavers and [the children]391-the children did n't know what to do or say when [they]391-the children saw [him]72-aslan . [People who have not been in [Narnia]7-narnia]767-people who have not been in narnia sometimes think that a thing can not be good and terrible at the same time . If [the children]391-the children had ever thought so , [they]391-the children were cured of it now . For when [they]391-the children tried to look at [Aslan]72-aslan 's face [they]391-the children just caught a glimpse of the golden mane and the great , royal , solemn , overwhelming eyes ; and then [they]391-the children found [they]391-the children could n't look at [him]72-aslan and went all trembly .

" Go on , "[71-mr. beaver] whispered [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver .

" No , "[38-peter] whispered [Peter]38-peter , " [you]72-aslan first . "[38-peter]

" [Susan]40-susan , "[38-peter] whispered [Peter]38-peter , " what about [you]72-aslan ? [Ladies]1682-ladies first . "[38-peter]

" No , [you]72-aslan 're [the eldest]1683-the eldest , "[40-susan] whispered [Susan]40-susan . And of course the longer [they]391-the children went on doing this the more awkward [they]391-the children felt . Then at last [Peter]38-peter realised that it was up to [him]38-peter . " [We]391-the children have come -- [Aslan]72-aslan . "[38-peter]

" Welcome , [Peter]38-peter , [Son of [Adam]48-adam]1320-son of adam , "[72-aslan] said [Aslan]72-aslan . " Welcome , [Susan]40-susan and [Lucy]60-lucy , [Daughters of Eve]86-daughters of eve . Welcome [He]72-aslan - [Beaver]71-mr. beaver and [She]1685-she - [Beaver]71-mr. beaver . "[72-aslan]

[His]72-aslan voice was deep and rich and somehow took the fidgets out of [them]1252-the others . [They]1252-the others now felt glad and quiet and it did n't seem awkward to [them]1252-the others to stand and say nothing .

" But where is the fourth ? "[72-aslan] asked [Aslan]72-aslan .

" [He]72-aslan has tried to betray [them]1252-the others and joined [the White Witch]1261-the white witch , [O Aslan]72-aslan , "[71-mr. beaver] said [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver . And then something made [Peter]38-peter say :

And [Aslan]72-aslan said nothing either to excuse [Peter]38-peter or to blame [him]38-peter but merely stood looking at [him]38-peter with [his]72-aslan great golden eyes . And it seemed to all of [them]1252-the others that there was nothing to be said .

[The Lion]72-aslan shook [his]72-aslan mane and clapped [his]72-aslan paws together ( " Terrible paws , "[60-lucy] thought [Lucy]60-lucy , " If [he]72-aslan did n't know how to velvet them ! "[60-lucy] ) and said :

When [the girls]139-the girls had gone [Aslan]72-aslan laid [his]72-aslan paw -- and though it was velveted it was very heavy -- on [Peter]38-peter 's shoulder and said , " Come , [Son of [Adam]48-adam]1320-son of adam , and [I]72-aslan will show [you]38-peter a far - off sight of [the castle where [you]38-peter are to be [King]1692-king]1691-the castle where you are to be king . "[72-aslan]

And [Peter]38-peter with [his]38-peter sword still drawn in [his]38-peter hand went with [the Lion]771-the lion to [the eastern edge of [the hill - top]773-the hill - top]772-the eastern edge of the hill - top . There a beautiful sight met [their]139-the girls eyes . The sun was setting behind [their]139-the girls backs . That meant that [the whole country]1471-the whole country below [them]139-the girls lay in the evening light -- forest and [hills and valleys]775-hills and valleys and , winding away like a silver snake , [the lower part of [the great river]777-the great river]776-the lower part of the great river . And beyond all this , miles away , was [the sea]1565-the sea , and beyond [the sea]1565-the sea the sky , full of clouds which were just turning rose colour with the reflection of the sunset . But just where [the land of [Narnia]7-narnia]1237-the land of narnia met [the sea]1565-the sea -- in fact , at [the mouth of [the great river]777-the great river]782-the mouth of the great river -- there was something on [a little hill]784-a little hill , shining . It was shining because it was [a castle]785-a castle and of course the sunlight was reflected from all the windows which looked towards [Peter]38-peter and the sunset ; but to [Peter]38-peter it looked like a great star resting on [the seashore]786-the seashore .

" That , [O Man]87-o man , "[72-aslan] said [Aslan]72-aslan , " is [Cair Paravel]66-cair paravel of the four thrones , in one of which [you]38-peter must sit as [King]1692-king . And once more [Peter]38-peter said nothing , for at that moment a strange noise woke the silence suddenly . It was like a bugle , but richer .

" It is [[your]38-peter sister]1368-your sister 's horn , "[72-aslan] said [Aslan]72-aslan to [Peter]38-peter in a low voice ; so low as to be almost a purr , if it is not disrespectful to think of a lion purring .

For a moment [Peter]38-peter did not understand . Then , when [he]38-peter saw [all the other creatures]787-all the other creatures start forward and heard [Aslan]72-aslan say with a wave of [his]72-aslan paw , " Back ! Let [the Prince]1340-the prince win [his]1340-the prince spurs , "[72-aslan] [he]72-aslan did understand , and set off running as hard as [he]72-aslan could to [the pavilion]1689-the pavilion . And there [he]38-peter saw a dreadful sight .

[The Naiads]789-the naiads and [Dryads]84-dryads were scattering in every direction . [Lucy]60-lucy was running towards [him]38-peter as fast as [her]60-lucy short legs would carry [her]60-lucy and [her]60-lucy face was as white as paper . Then [he]38-peter saw [Susan]40-susan make a dash for a tree , and swing [herself]40-susan up , followed by a huge grey beast . At first [Peter]38-peter thought it was a bear . Then [he]38-peter saw that it looked like an Alsatian , though it was far too big to be a dog . Then [he]38-peter realised that it was a wolf -- a wolf standing on [its]790-its hind legs , with [its]790-its front paws against the tree - trunk snapping and snarling . All the hair on its back stood up on end . [Susan]40-susan had not been able to get higher than the second big branch . One of [her]40-susan legs hung down so that [her]40-susan foot was only an inch or two above the snapping teeth . [Peter]38-peter wondered why [she]40-susan did not get higher or at least take a better grip ; then [he]38-peter realised that [she]40-susan was just going to faint and that if [she]40-susan fainted [she]40-susan would fall off .

[Peter]38-peter did not feel very brave ; indeed , [he]38-peter felt [he]38-peter was going to be sick . But that made no difference to what [he]38-peter had to do . [He]38-peter rushed straight up to [the monster]791-the monster and aimed a slash of [his]38-peter sword at its side . That stroke never reached [the Wolf]82-the wolf . Quick as lightning it turned round , its eyes flaming , and its mouth wide open in a howl of anger . If it had not been so angry that it simply had to howl it would have got [him]38-peter by the throat at once . As it was -- though all this happened too quickly for [Peter]38-peter to think at all -- [he]38-peter had just time to duck down and plunge [his]38-peter sword , as hard as [he]38-peter could , between the brute 's forelegs into its heart . Then came a horrible , confused moment like something in a nightmare . [He]38-peter was tugging and pulling and [the Wolf]82-the wolf seemed neither alive nor dead , and its bared teeth knocked against [his]38-peter forehead , and everything was blood and heat and hair . A moment later [he]38-peter found that [the monster]791-the monster lay dead and [he]38-peter had drawn [his]38-peter sword out of it and was straightening [his]38-peter back and rubbing the sweat off [his]38-peter face and out of [his]38-peter eyes . [He]38-peter felt tired all over .

Then , after a bit , [Susan]40-susan came down the tree . [She]40-susan and [Peter]38-peter felt pretty shaky when [they]793-they met and [I]0-i wo n't say there was n't kissing and crying on both sides . But in [Narnia]7-narnia [no one]1221-no one thinks any the worse of [you]795-you for that .

" Quick ! Quick ! "[72-aslan] shouted the voice of [Aslan]72-aslan , " Centaurs ! [Eagles]88-eagles ! [I]72-aslan see another wolf in the thickets . There -- behind [you]795-you . [He]1698-he has just darted away . After [him]1698-he , all of [you]795-you ! [He]1698-he will be going to [[his]1698-he mistress]1699-his mistress . Now is [your]795-you chance to find [the Witch]1280-the witch and rescue [the fourth Son of Adam]1701-the fourth son of adam . "[72-aslan] And instantly with a thunder of hoofs and a beating of wings [a dozen or so of the swiftest creatures]796-a dozen or so of the swiftest creatures disappeared into the gathering darkness .

[Peter]38-peter , still out of breath , turned and saw [Aslan]72-aslan close at hand .

" [You]38-peter have forgotten to clean [your]38-peter sword , "[72-aslan] said [Aslan]72-aslan .

It was true . [Peter]38-peter blushed when [he]38-peter looked at the bright blade and saw it all smeared with the [Wolf]82-the wolf 's hair and blood . [He]38-peter stooped down and wiped it quite clean on the grass , and then wiped it quite dry on [his]38-peter coat .

" Hand it to [me]72-aslan and kneel , [Son of [Adam]48-adam]1320-son of adam , "[72-aslan] said [Aslan]72-aslan . And when [Peter]38-peter had done so [he]38-peter struck [him]38-peter with the flat of the blade and said , " Rise up , [Sir Peter Fenris - Bane]38-peter . And , whatever happens , never forget to wipe [your]38-peter sword . "[38-peter]

CHAPTER XIII

_ Deep Magic from the Dawn of Time _

Now [we]797-we must go back to [Edmund]36-edmund . When [he]36-edmund had been made to walk far further than [he]36-edmund had ever known that [anybody _ could _ walk]798-anybody _ could _ walk , [the Witch]1280-the witch at last halted in [a dark valley all overshadowed with fir trees and yew trees]800-a dark valley all overshadowed with fir trees and yew trees . [Edmund]36-edmund simply sank down and lay on [his]36-edmund face , doing nothing at all and not even caring what was going to happen next provided [they]801-they would let [him]36-edmund lie still . [He]36-edmund was too tired even to notice how hungry and thirsty [he]36-edmund was . [The Witch]1280-the witch and [the Dwarf]263-the dwarf were talking close beside [him]36-edmund in low tones .

" No , "[263-the dwarf] said [the Dwarf]263-the dwarf , " it is no use now , [O Queen]1663-o queen . [They]801-they must have reached [the Stone Table]19-the stone table by now . "[263-the dwarf]

" Perhaps [the Wolf]82-the wolf will smell [us]1704-we out and bring [us]1704-we news , "[1280-the witch] said [the Witch]1280-the witch .

" It can not be good news if [he]82-the wolf does , "[263-the dwarf] said [the Dwarf]263-the dwarf .

" [Four thrones in [Cair Paravel]8-cair paravel]1705-four thrones in cair paravel , "[1280-the witch] said [the Witch]1280-the witch . " How if only three were filled ? That would not fulfil the prophecy . "[1280-the witch]

" What difference would that make now that _ [he]82-the wolf _ is [here]1219-here ? "[263-the dwarf] said [the Dwarf]263-the dwarf . [He]263-the dwarf did not dare , even now , to mention the name of [Aslan]72-aslan to [[his]263-the dwarf mistress]1699-his mistress .

" [He]82-the wolf may not stay long . And then -- [we]1704-we would fall upon the three at [Cair]15-cair . "[1280-the witch]

" Yet it might be better , "[263-the dwarf] said [the Dwarf]263-the dwarf , " to keep [this one]1707-this one "[263-the dwarf] ( here [he]263-the dwarf kicked [Edmund]36-edmund ) " for bargaining with . "[263-the dwarf]

" Yes ! And have [him]82-the wolf rescued , "[1280-the witch] said [the Witch]1280-the witch scornfully .

" Then , "[263-the dwarf] said [the Dwarf]263-the dwarf , " [we]1704-we had better do what [we]1704-we have to do at once . "[263-the dwarf]

" It will be a long time now before the Stone Table can again be put to its proper use , "[263-the dwarf] said [the Dwarf]263-the dwarf .

At that moment with a rush and a snarl [a Wolf]816-a wolf rushed up to [them]817-we .

" [I]816-a wolf have seen [them]817-we . [They]817-we are all at [the Stone Table]19-the stone table , with _ [him]82-the wolf _ . " No , "[1280-the witch] said [the Witch]1280-the witch . " There need be no flying . Go quickly . [The great brute]819-the great brute bowed [its]819-the great brute head , turned , and galloped away .

" Now ! "[820-she] said [she]820-she , " [we]817-we have no table -- let [me]820-she see . [We]817-we had better put it against the trunk of a tree . "[820-she]

[Edmund]36-edmund found [himself]36-edmund being roughly forced to [his]36-edmund feet . Then [the Dwarf]263-the dwarf set [him]36-edmund with [his]36-edmund back against a tree and bound [him]36-edmund fast . [He]36-edmund saw [the Witch]1280-the witch take off [her]1280-the witch outer mantle . [Her]1280-the witch arms were bare underneath it and terribly white . Because they were so very white [he]36-edmund could not see much else , it was so dark in [this valley under the dark trees]823-this valley under the dark trees .

" Prepare [the victim]1718-the victim , "[1280-the witch] said [the Witch]1280-the witch . And [the Dwarf]263-the dwarf undid [Edmund]36-edmund 's collar and folded back [his]36-edmund shirt at the neck . Then [he]263-the dwarf took [Edmund]36-edmund 's hair and pulled [his]36-edmund head back so that [he]36-edmund had to raise [his]36-edmund chin . After that [Edmund]36-edmund heard a strange noise -- whizz -- whizz -- whizz . For a moment [he]36-edmund could n't think what it was . Then [he]36-edmund realised . It was the sound of a knife being sharpened !

At that very moment [he]36-edmund heard loud shouts from every direction -- a drumming of hoofs and a beating of wings -- a scream from [the Witch]1280-the witch -- confusion all round [him]36-edmund . And then [he]36-edmund found [he]36-edmund was being untied . Strong arms were round [him]36-edmund and [he]36-edmund heard big , kind voices saying things like " Let [him]36-edmund lie down -- give [him]36-edmund some wine -- drink this -- steady now -- you'll be all right in a minute . "[827-people who were talking not to him but to one another]

Then [he]36-edmund heard the voices of [people who were talking not to [him]36-edmund but to [one another]186-one another]827-people who were talking not to him but to one another . And [they]827-people who were talking not to him but to one another were saying things like " Who 's got [the Witch?--I]1719-the witch?--i thought [you]36-edmund had [her]1280-the witch -- [I]827-people who were talking not to him but to one another did n't see [her]1280-the witch after [I]827-people who were talking not to him but to one another knocked the knife out of [her]1280-the witch hand -- [I]827-people who were talking not to him but to one another was after [the Dwarf]263-the dwarf -- Do [you]36-edmund mean to say [she]1280-the witch 's escaped?--A chap ca n't mind everything at once -- What 's that ? Oh sorry it 's only an old stump ! "[827-people who were talking not to him but to one another] But just at this point [Edmund]36-edmund went off in a dead faint .

Presently [the centaurs]829-the centaurs and unicorns and deer and birds ( [they]827-people who were talking not to him but to one another were of course the rescue party which [Aslan]72-aslan had sent in the last chapter ) all set off to go back to the Stone Table , carrying [Edmund]36-edmund with [them]827-people who were talking not to him but to one another . But if [they]827-people who were talking not to him but to one another could have seen what happened in [that valley]444-that valley after [they]827-people who were talking not to him but to one another had gone , [I]0-i think [they]827-people who were talking not to him but to one another might have been surprised .

It was perfectly still and presently the moon grew bright , if [you]831-you had been [there]283-there [you]831-you would have seen the moonlight shining on an old tree - stump and on a fair sized boulder . But if [you]831-you had gone on looking [you]831-you would gradually have begun to think there was something odd about both the stump and the boulder . And next [you]831-you would have thought that the stump did look really remarkably like [a little fat man crouching on the ground]833-a little fat man crouching on the ground . And if [you]831-you had watched long enough [you]831-you would have seen the stump walk across to the boulder and the boulder sit up and begin talking to the stump ; for in reality the stump and the boulder were simply [the Witch]1280-the witch and [the Dwarf]263-the dwarf . For it was part of [her]1280-the witch magic that [she]1280-the witch could make things look like what they were n't , and [she]1280-the witch had the presence of mind to do so at the very moment when the knife was knocked out of [her]1280-the witch hand . [She]1280-the witch had kept hold of [her]1280-the witch wand also , so it had been kept safe , too .

When [the other children]836-the other children woke up next morning ( [they]836-the other children had been sleeping on piles of cushions in [the pavilion]1689-the pavilion ) the first thing [they]836-the other children heard -- from [Mrs. Beaver]73-mrs. beaver -- was that [[their]836-the other children brother]838-their brother had been rescued and brought into [camp]839-camp late last night ; and was at that moment with [Aslan]72-aslan . As soon as [they]836-the other children had breakfasted [they]836-the other children all went out , and there [they]836-the other children saw [Aslan]72-aslan and [Edmund]36-edmund walking together in the dewy grass , apart from [the rest of [the court]841-the court]840-the rest of the court . There is no need to tell [you]842-you ( and [no one]1221-no one ever heard ) what [Aslan]72-aslan was saying but it was a conversation which [Edmund]36-edmund never forgot . As [the others]1252-the others drew nearer [Aslan]72-aslan turned to meet [them]1252-the others bringing [Edmund]36-edmund with [him]72-aslan .

" Here is [[your]842-you brother]1326-your brother , "[72-aslan] [he]72-aslan said , " and -- there is no need to talk to [him]1326-your brother about what is past . "[72-aslan]

[Edmund]36-edmund shook hands with [each of [the others]1252-the others]845-each of the others and said to each of [them]1252-the others in turn , " [I]36-edmund 'm sorry , "[36-edmund] and [everyone]153-everyone said " That 's all right . "[153-everyone] And then [everyone]153-everyone wanted very hard to say something which would make it quite clear that [they]153-everyone were all friends with [him]36-edmund again -- something ordinary and natural -- and of course [no one]1221-no one could think of anything in [the world]1259-the world to say . But before [they]153-everyone had time to feel really awkward one of [the leopards]851-the leopards approached [Aslan]72-aslan and said :

" [Sire]1722-sire , there is [a messenger from [the enemy who craves audience]1724-the enemy who craves audience]1723-a messenger from the enemy who craves audience . "[851-the leopards]

"[263-the dwarf]

" [Queen of [Narnia]7-narnia]1458-queen of narnia , indeed ! "[71-mr. beaver] said [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver . " Of all the cheek-- "[71-mr. beaver]

"[72-aslan]

This was agreed to and [two leopards]855-two leopards went back with [the Dwarf]263-the dwarf to see that the conditions were properly carried out . " But supposing [she]1732-your mistress turns the two leopards into stone ? "[60-lucy] whispered [Lucy]60-lucy to [Peter]38-peter . [I]0-i think the same idea had occurred to [the leopards]851-the leopards [themselves]851-the leopards ; at any rate , as [they]851-the leopards walked off [their]851-the leopards fur was all standing up on [their]851-the leopards backs and [their]851-the leopards tails were bristling -- like a cat 's when it sees a strange dog .

" It 'll be all right , "[38-peter] whispered [Peter]38-peter in reply . " [He]38-peter would n't send [them]851-the leopards if it were n't . "[38-peter]

A few minutes later [the Witch]1280-the witch [herself]1280-the witch walked out on to [the top of [the hill]860-the hill]859-the top of the hill and came straight across and stood before [Aslan]72-aslan . [The three children]495-the three children , who had not seen [her]1280-the witch before , felt shudders running down [their]495-the three children backs at the sight of [her]1280-the witch face ; and there were low growls among all the animals present . Though it was bright sunshine [everyone]153-everyone felt suddenly cold . [The only two people present]863-the only two people present who seemed to be quite at [their]863-the only two people present ease were [Aslan]72-aslan and [the Witch]1280-the witch [herself]1280-the witch . It was the oddest thing to see those two faces -- [the golden face and the dead - white face]865-the golden face and the dead - white face -- so close together . Not that [the Witch]1280-the witch looked [Aslan]72-aslan exactly in [his]72-aslan eyes ; [Mrs. Beaver]73-mrs. beaver particularly noticed this .

" [You]72-aslan have [a traitor]1734-a traitor there , [Aslan]72-aslan , "[1280-the witch] said [the Witch]1280-the witch . Of course [everyone present]868-everyone present knew that [she]1280-the witch meant [Edmund]36-edmund . But [Edmund]36-edmund had got past thinking about [himself]36-edmund after all [he]36-edmund 'd been through and after the talk [he]36-edmund 'd had that morning . [He]36-edmund just went on looking at [Aslan]72-aslan . It did n't seem to matter what [the Witch]1280-the witch said .

" Well , "[72-aslan] said [Aslan]72-aslan . " [His]36-edmund offence was not against [you]72-aslan . "[72-aslan]

" Have [you]72-aslan forgotten the Deep Magic ? "[59-the witch] asked [the Witch]59-the witch .

" Let [us]1735-us say [I]72-aslan have forgotten it , "[72-aslan] answered [Aslan]72-aslan gravely . " Tell [us]1735-us of this Deep Magic . "[72-aslan]

" Tell [you]72-aslan ? "[1280-the witch] said [the Witch]1280-the witch , [her]1280-the witch voice growing suddenly shriller . " Tell [you]72-aslan what is written on that very Table of Stone which stands beside [us]1735-us ? Tell [you]72-aslan what is written in letters deep as a spear is long on the trunk of [the World Ash Tree]23-the world ash tree ? Tell [you]72-aslan what is engraved on the sceptre of [the Emperor - Beyond - [the - Sea]14-the - sea]24-the emperor - beyond - the - sea ? [You]72-aslan at least know the magic which [the Emperor]1736-the emperor put into [Narnia]7-narnia at the very beginning . [You]72-aslan know that [every traitor]1737-every traitor belongs to [me]1280-the witch as [[my]1280-the witch lawful prey]1738-my lawful prey and that for every treachery [I]1280-the witch have a right to a kill . "[1280-the witch]

" Oh , "[71-mr. beaver] said [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver . " So _ that 's _ how [you]72-aslan came to imagine [yourself]72-aslan [a Queen]1299-a queen -- because [you]72-aslan were [[the Emperor]1736-the emperor 's hangman]1741-the emperor 's hangman . [I]71-mr. beaver see . "[71-mr. beaver]

" Peace , [Beaver]71-mr. beaver , "[72-aslan] said [Aslan]72-aslan , with a very low growl .

" And so , "[1280-the witch] continued [the Witch]1280-the witch , " [that human creature]1742-that human creature is [mine]1280-the witch . [His]1742-that human creature life is forfeit to [me]1280-the witch . [His]1742-that human creature blood is [my]1280-the witch property . "[1280-the witch]

" Come and take it then , "[872-the bull with the man] said [the Bull with the man]872-the bull with the man 's head in a great bellowing voice .

" [Fool]1654-fool , "[1280-the witch] said [the Witch]1280-the witch with a savage smile that was almost a snarl , " do [you]1654-fool really think [[your]1654-fool master]1744-your master can rob [me]1280-the witch of [my]1280-the witch rights by mere force ? [He]1744-your master knows the Deep Magic better than that . [He]1744-your master knows that unless [I]1280-the witch have blood as the Law says [all Narnia]1745-all narnia will be overturned and perish in fire and water . "[1280-the witch]

" It is very true , "[72-aslan] said [Aslan]72-aslan ; " [I]72-aslan do not deny it . "[72-aslan]

" Oh , [Aslan]72-aslan ! "[40-susan] whispered [Susan]40-susan in [the Lion]72-aslan 's ear , " ca n't [we]1746-we -- [I]40-susan mean , [you]72-aslan wo n't , will [you]72-aslan ? Ca n't [we]1746-we do something about the Deep Magic ? Is n't there something [you]72-aslan can work against it ? "[40-susan]

" Work against [the Emperor]1736-the emperor 's magic ? "[72-aslan] said [Aslan]72-aslan turning to [her]40-susan with something like a frown on [his]72-aslan face . And [nobody]1288-nobody ever made that suggestion to [him]72-aslan again .

[Edmund]36-edmund was on the other side of [Aslan]72-aslan , looking all the time at [Aslan]72-aslan 's face . [He]36-edmund felt a choking feeling and wondered if [he]36-edmund ought to say something ; but a moment later [he]36-edmund felt that [he]36-edmund was not expected to do anything except to wait , and do what [he]36-edmund was told .

" Fall back , all of [you]875-they , "[72-aslan] said [Aslan]72-aslan , " and [I]72-aslan will talk to [the Witch]1280-the witch alone . "[72-aslan]

[They]875-they all obeyed . It was a terrible time this -- waiting and wondering while [the Lion]771-the lion and [the Witch]1280-the witch talked earnestly together in low voices . [Lucy]60-lucy said , " Oh , [Edmund]36-edmund ! "[60-lucy] and began to cry . [Peter]38-peter stood with [his]38-peter back to [the others]1252-the others looking out at [the distant sea]879-the distant sea . [The Beavers]37-the beavers stood holding each other 's paws with [their]37-the beavers heads bowed . The centaurs stamped uneasily with [their]880-their hoofs . But [everyone]153-everyone became perfectly still in the end , so that [you]882-you noticed even small sounds like a bumble bee flying past , or the birds in [the forest down below]883-the forest down below [them]875-they , or the wind rustling the leaves . And still the talk between [Aslan]72-aslan and [the White Witch]1261-the white witch went on .

At last [they]875-they heard [Aslan]72-aslan 's voice . " [You]875-they can all come back , "[72-aslan] [he]72-aslan said . " [I]72-aslan have settled the matter . [She]1280-the witch has renounced the claim on [[your]875-they brother]1326-your brother 's blood . "[72-aslan] And all over [the hill]860-the hill there was a noise as if [everyone]153-everyone had been holding [his]153-everyone breath and had now begun breathing again , and then a murmur of talk . [They]875-they began to come back to [[Aslan]72-aslan 's throne]887-aslan 's throne .

[The Witch]1280-the witch was just turning away with a look of fierce joy on [her]1280-the witch face when [she]1280-the witch stopped and said ,

" But how do [I]1280-the witch know this promise will be kept ? "[1280-the witch]

" Wow ! "[72-aslan] roared [Aslan]72-aslan half rising from [his]72-aslan throne ; and [his]72-aslan great mouth opened wider and wider and the roar grew louder and louder , and [the Witch]1280-the witch , after staring for a moment with [her]1280-the witch lips wide apart , picked up [her]1280-the witch skirts and fairly ran for [her]1280-the witch life .

CHAPTER XIV

_ The Triumph of [the Witch]1280-the witch _

As soon as [the Witch]59-the witch had gone [Aslan]72-aslan said , " [We]1750-we must move from [this place]254-this place at once , it will be wanted for other purposes . [We]1750-we shall encamp to - night at [the Fords of [Beruna]26-beruna]25-the fords of beruna . "[72-aslan]

Of course [everyone]153-everyone was dying to ask [him]72-aslan how [he]72-aslan had arranged matters with [the Witch]1280-the witch ; but [his]72-aslan face was stern and [everyone]153-everyone 's ears were still ringing with the sound of [his]72-aslan roar and so [nobody]1288-nobody dared .

After a meal , which was taken in the open air on [the hill - top]773-the hill - top ( for the sun had got strong by now and dried the grass ) [they]153-everyone were busy for a while taking [the pavilion]1689-the pavilion down and packing things up . Before two o'clock [they]153-everyone were on the march and set off in a North - Westerly direction , walking at an easy pace for [they]153-everyone had not far to go .

During the first part of the journey [Aslan]72-aslan explained to [Peter]38-peter [his]72-aslan plan of campaign . " As soon as [she]1280-the witch has finished [her]1280-the witch business in these parts , "[72-aslan] [he]72-aslan said , " [the Witch]1280-the witch and [[her]1280-the witch crew]1753-her crew will almost certainly fall back to [[her]1280-the witch house]1512-her house and prepare for a siege . [You]38-peter may or may not be able to cut [her]1280-the witch off and prevent [her]1280-the witch from reaching it . "[72-aslan] [He]72-aslan then went on to outline two plans of battle -- one for fighting [the Witch]1280-the witch and [[her]1280-the witch people]898-her people in [the wood]1273-the wood and another for assaulting [[her]1280-the witch castle]900-her castle . And all the time [he]72-aslan was advising [Peter]38-peter how to conduct the operations , saying things like , " [You]38-peter must put [your]38-peter centaurs in such and such a place "[72-aslan] or " [You]38-peter must post [scouts]1755-scouts to see that [she]1280-the witch does n't do so - and - so , "[72-aslan] till at last [Peter]38-peter said ,

" But [you]72-aslan will be there [yourself]72-aslan , [Aslan]72-aslan . "[38-peter]

" [I]771-the lion can give [you]38-peter no promise of that , "[771-the lion] answered [the Lion]771-the lion . And [he]771-the lion continued giving [Peter]38-peter [his]72-aslan instructions .

For the last part of the journey it was [Susan]40-susan and [Lucy]60-lucy who saw most of [him]72-aslan . [He]72-aslan did not talk very much and seemed to [them]902-they to be sad .

It was still afternoon when [they]902-they came down to [a place where [the river valley]745-the river valley had widened out and [the river]1361-the river was broad and shallow]903-a place where the river valley had widened out and the river was broad and shallow . This was [the Fords of [Beruna]26-beruna]906-the fords of beruna and [Aslan]72-aslan gave orders to halt on [this side of the water]907-this side of the water . But [Peter]38-peter said ,

" Would n't it be better to camp on [the far side]519-the far side -- for fear [she]1757-she should try a night attack or anything ? "[38-peter]

[Aslan]72-aslan who seemed to have been thinking about something else roused [himself]72-aslan with a shake of [his]72-aslan magnificent mane and said , " Eh ? What 's that ? "[72-aslan] [Peter]38-peter said it all over again .

" No , "[72-aslan] said [Aslan]72-aslan in a dull voice , as if it did n't matter . " No . [She]1757-she will not make an attack to - night . "[72-aslan] And then [he]72-aslan sighed deeply . But presently [he]72-aslan added , " All the same it was well thought of . That is how [a soldier]1758-a soldier ought to think . But it does n't really matter . "[72-aslan] So [they]902-they proceeded to pitch [[their]902-they camp]908-their camp .

[Aslan]72-aslan 's mood affected [everyone]153-everyone that evening . [Peter]38-peter was feeling uncomfortable too at the idea of fighting the battle on [his]38-peter own ; the news that [Aslan]72-aslan might not be there had come as a great shock to [him]38-peter . Supper that evening was a quiet meal . [Everyone]153-everyone felt how different it had been last night or even that morning . It was as if the good times , having just begun , were already drawing to their end .

This feeling affected [Susan]40-susan so much that [she]40-susan could n't get to sleep when [she]40-susan went to bed . And after [she]40-susan had lain counting sheep and turning over and over [she]40-susan heard [Lucy]60-lucy give a long sigh and turn over just beside [her]40-susan in the darkness .

" Ca n't [you]60-lucy get to sleep either ? "[40-susan] said [Susan]40-susan .

" No , "[60-lucy] said [Lucy]60-lucy . " [I]60-lucy thought [you]40-susan were asleep . [I]60-lucy say , [Susan]40-susan ? "[60-lucy]

" What ? "[60-lucy]

" [I]60-lucy 've a most horrible feeling -- as if something were hanging over [us]1759-us . "[60-lucy]

" Have [you]60-lucy ? Because , as a matter of fact , so have [I.]60-lucy "[60-lucy]

" Something about [Aslan]72-aslan , "[60-lucy] said [Lucy]60-lucy . " Either some dreadful thing that is going to happen to [him]72-aslan , or something dreadful that [he]72-aslan 's going to do . "[60-lucy]

" There 's been something wrong with [him]72-aslan all afternoon , "[40-susan] said [Susan]40-susan . " [Lucy]60-lucy ! What was that [he]72-aslan said about not being with [us]1759-us at the battle ? [You]60-lucy do n't think [he]72-aslan could be stealing away and leaving [us]1759-us to - night , do [you]60-lucy ? "[40-susan]

" Where is [he]72-aslan now ? "[60-lucy] said [Lucy]60-lucy . " Is [he]72-aslan here in [the pavilion]1689-the pavilion ? "[60-lucy]

" [I]40-susan do n't think so . "[40-susan]

" [Susan]40-susan ! Let 's go outside and have a look round . [We]1759-us might see [him]72-aslan . "[60-lucy]

" All right . Let 's , "[40-susan] said [Susan]40-susan , " [we]1759-us might just as well be doing that as lying awake here . "[40-susan]

Very quietly [the two girls]355-the two girls groped [their]355-the two girls way among [the other sleepers]912-the other sleepers and crept out of [the tent]913-the tent . The moonlight was bright and everything was quite still except for the noise of [the river]1361-the river chattering over the stones . Then [Susan]40-susan suddenly caught [Lucy]60-lucy 's arm and said , " Look ! "[40-susan] On the far side of [the camping ground]915-the camping ground , just where the trees began , [they]355-the two girls saw the Lion slowly walking away from [them]355-the two girls into [the wood]1273-the wood . Without a word [they]355-the two girls both followed [him]917-he .

[He]917-he led [them]355-the two girls up [the steep slope]918-the steep slope out of [the river valley]745-the river valley and then slightly to the left -- apparently by the very same route which [they]355-the two girls had used that afternoon in coming from [the Hill of [the Stone Table]19-the stone table]920-the hill of the stone table . On and on [he]917-he led [them]355-the two girls , into dark shadows and out into pale moonlight , getting [their]355-the two girls feet wet with the heavy dew . [He]917-he looked somehow different from [the Aslan [they]355-the two girls knew]921-the aslan they knew . [His]917-he tail and [his]917-he head hung low and [he]917-he walked slowly as if [he]917-he were very , very tired . Then , when [they]355-the two girls were crossing [a wide open place where there were no shadows for [them]355-the two girls to hide in]922-a wide open place where there were no shadows for them to hide in , [he]917-he stopped and looked round . It was no good trying to run away so [they]355-the two girls came towards [him]917-he . When [they]355-the two girls were closer [he]917-he said ,

" Oh , [children]117-children , [children]117-children , why are [you]117-children following [me]917-he ? "[917-he]

" [We]355-the two girls could n't sleep , "[60-lucy] said [Lucy]60-lucy -- and then felt sure that [she]60-lucy need say no more and that [Aslan]72-aslan knew all [they]355-the two girls had been thinking .

" Please , may [we]355-the two girls come with [you]917-he -- wherever [you]917-he 're going ? "[40-susan] said [Susan]40-susan .

" Well-- "[72-aslan] said [Aslan]72-aslan and seemed to be thinking . Then [he]72-aslan said , " [I]72-aslan should be glad of company to - night . Yes , [you]117-children may come , if [you]117-children will promise to stop when [I]72-aslan tell [you]117-children , and after that leave [me]72-aslan to go on alone . "[72-aslan]

" Oh , thank [you]917-he , thank [you]917-he . And [we]355-the two girls will , "[355-the two girls] said [the two girls]355-the two girls .

Forward [they]355-the two girls went again and [one of [the girls]139-the girls]924-one of the girls walked on each side of the Lion . But how slowly [he]72-aslan walked ! And [his]72-aslan great , royal head drooped so that [his]72-aslan nose nearly touched the grass . Presently [he]72-aslan stumbled and gave a low moan .

" [Aslan]72-aslan ! [Dear Aslan]95-dear aslan ! "[60-lucy] said [Lucy]60-lucy , " what is wrong ? Ca n't [you]72-aslan tell [us]355-the two girls ? "[60-lucy]

" Are [you]95-dear aslan ill , [dear Aslan]95-dear aslan ? "[40-susan] asked [Susan]40-susan .

" No , "[95-dear aslan] said [Aslan]95-dear aslan . " [I]95-dear aslan am sad and lonely . Lay [your]139-the girls hands on [my]95-dear aslan mane so that [I]95-dear aslan can feel [you]139-the girls are there and let [us]355-the two girls walk like that . "[95-dear aslan]

And so [the girls]139-the girls did what [they]139-the girls would never have dared to do without [his]72-aslan permission but what [they]139-the girls had longed to do ever since [they]139-the girls first saw [him]72-aslan -- buried [their]139-the girls cold hands in the beautiful sea of fur and stroked it and , so doing , walked with [him]72-aslan . And presently [they]139-the girls saw that [they]139-the girls were going with [him]72-aslan up the slope of [the hill on which the Stone Table stood]927-the hill on which the stone table stood . [They]139-the girls went up at the side where the trees came furthest up , and when [they]139-the girls got to the last tree ( it was one that had some bushes about [it]928-it ) [Aslan]95-dear aslan stopped and said ,

" Oh , [children]117-children , [children]117-children . Here [you]117-children must stop . And whatever happens , do not let [yourselves]117-children be seen . Farewell . "[95-dear aslan]

And both [the girls]139-the girls cried bitterly ( though [they]139-the girls hardly knew why ) and clung to [the Lion]72-aslan and kissed [his]72-aslan mane and [his]72-aslan nose and [his]72-aslan paws and [his]72-aslan great , sad eyes . Then [he]72-aslan turned from [them]139-the girls and walked out onto [the top of [the hill]860-the hill]859-the top of the hill . And [Lucy]60-lucy and [Susan]40-susan , crouching in the bushes , looked after [him]72-aslan and this is what [they]139-the girls saw .

[A great crowd of people]932-a great crowd of people were standing all round the Stone Table and though the moon was shining many of [them]932-a great crowd of people carried torches which burned with evil - looking red flames and black smoke . But [such people]933-such people ! [Ogres with monstrous teeth , and wolves]934-ogres with monstrous teeth , and wolves , and [bull - headed men]935-bull - headed men ; [spirits of evil trees and poisonous plants]936-spirits of evil trees and poisonous plants ; and other creatures whom [I]0-i wo n't describe because if [I]0-i did [the grown - ups]937-the grown - ups would probably not let [you]938-you read this book -- Cruels and [Hags]93-the hags and Incubuses , [Wraiths , Horrors , Efreets , Sprites , Orknies , Wooses]939-wraiths , horrors , efreets , sprites , orknies , wooses , and [Ettins]96-ettins . In fact here were all those who were on [the Witch]59-the witch 's side and whom [the Wolf]82-the wolf had summoned at [her]59-the witch command . And right in the middle , standing by the Table , was [the Witch]1280-the witch [herself]1280-the witch .

A howl and a gibber of dismay went up from the creatures when [they]139-the girls first saw the great Lion pacing towards [them]139-the girls , and for a moment [the Witch]1280-the witch [herself]1280-the witch seemed to be struck with fear . Then [she]1280-the witch recovered [herself]1280-the witch and gave a wild , fierce laugh .

" [The fool]1765-the fool ! "[1280-the witch] [she]1280-the witch cried . " [The fool]1765-the fool has come . Bind [him]72-aslan fast . "[1280-the witch]

[Lucy]60-lucy and [Susan]40-susan held [their]139-the girls breaths waiting for [Aslan]72-aslan 's roar and [his]72-aslan spring upon [[his]72-aslan enemies]942-his enemies . But it never came . [Four hags]943-four hags , grinning and leering , yet also ( at first ) hanging back and half afraid of what [they]943-four hags had to do , had approached [him]72-aslan . " Bind [him]72-aslan , [I]1261-the white witch say ! "[1261-the white witch] repeated [the White Witch]1261-the white witch . [The hags]945-the hags made a dart at [him]72-aslan and shrieked with triumph when [they]945-the hags found that [he]72-aslan made no resistance at all . Then others -- [evil dwarfs]946-evil dwarfs and apes -- rushed in to help [them]943-four hags and between [them]943-four hags [they]945-the hags rolled the huge Lion round on [his]72-aslan back and tied all [his]72-aslan four paws together , shouting and cheering as if [they]945-the hags had done something brave , though , had [the Lion]72-aslan chosen , one of those paws could have been the death of [them]945-the hags all . But [he]72-aslan made no noise , even when [the enemies]947-the enemies , straining and tugging , pulled the cords so tight that they cut into [his]72-aslan flesh . Then [they]947-the enemies began to drag [him]72-aslan towards [the Stone Table]1545-the stone table .

" Stop ! "[1280-the witch] said [the Witch]1280-the witch . " Let [him]72-aslan first be shaved . "[1280-the witch]

Another roar of mean laughter went up from [[her]1280-the witch followers]950-her followers as [an ogre with a pair of shears]951-an ogre with a pair of shears came forward and squatted down by [Aslan]72-aslan 's head . [Snip]97-snip - snip - snip went the shears and masses of curling gold began to fall to the ground . Then [the ogre]952-the ogre stood back and [the children]391-the children , watching from [their]391-the children hiding - place , could see the face of [Aslan]72-aslan looking all small and different without its mane . [The enemies]947-the enemies also saw the difference .

" Why , [he]72-aslan 's only a great cat after all ! "[1408-one] cried [one]1408-one .

" Is _ that _ what [we]947-the enemies were afraid of ? "[947-the enemies] said another .

And [they]947-the enemies surged round [Aslan]72-aslan jeering at [him]72-aslan , saying things like " [Puss]98-puss , [Puss]98-puss !
