"[947-the enemies]

" Oh how _ can _ [they]947-the enemies ? "[60-lucy] said [Lucy]60-lucy , tears streaming down [her]60-lucy cheeks . " [The brutes]1767-the brutes , [the brutes]1767-the brutes ! "[60-lucy] for now that the first shock was over the shorn face of [Aslan]72-aslan looked to [her]60-lucy braver , and more beautiful , and more patient than ever .

" Muzzle [him]72-aslan ! "[1280-the witch] said [the Witch]1280-the witch . And even now , as [they]947-the enemies worked about [his]72-aslan face putting on the muzzle , one bite from [his]72-aslan jaws would have cost two or three of [them]947-the enemies [their]947-the enemies hands . But [he]72-aslan never moved . And this seemed to enrage [all that rabble]957-all that rabble . [Everyone]153-everyone was at [him]72-aslan now . [Those who had been afraid to come near]959-those who had been afraid to come near [him]72-aslan even after [he]72-aslan was bound began to find [their]959-those who had been afraid to come near courage , and for a few minutes [the two girls]355-the two girls could not even see [him]72-aslan -- so thickly was [he]72-aslan surrounded by the whole crowd of creatures kicking [him]72-aslan , hitting [him]72-aslan , spitting on [him]72-aslan , jeering at [him]72-aslan .

At last [the rabble]961-the rabble had had enough of this . [They]947-the enemies began to drag [the bound and muzzled Lion]962-the bound and muzzled lion to [the Stone Table]1545-the stone table , some pulling and some pushing . [He]72-aslan was so huge that even when [they]947-the enemies got [him]72-aslan there it took all [their]947-the enemies efforts to hoist [him]72-aslan onto the surface of it . Then there was more tying and tightening of cords .

" [The cowards]1769-the cowards ! [The cowards]1769-the cowards ! "[40-susan] sobbed [Susan]40-susan . " Are [they]947-the enemies _ still _ afraid of [him]72-aslan , even now ? "[40-susan]

When once [Aslan]72-aslan had been tied ( and tied so that [he]72-aslan was really a mass of cords ) on the flat stone , a hush fell on [the crowd]964-the crowd . [Four Hags]943-four hags , holding four torches , stood at the corners of the Table . [The Witch]1280-the witch bared [her]1280-the witch arms as [she]1280-the witch had bared [them]967-them the previous night when it had been [Edmund]36-edmund instead of [Aslan]72-aslan . Then [she]1280-the witch began to whet [her]1280-the witch knife . It looked to [the children]391-the children , when the gleam of the torchlight fell on it , as if the knife were made of stone not of steel and it was of a strange and evil shape .

At last [she]1280-the witch drew near . [She]1280-the witch stood by [Aslan]72-aslan 's head . [Her]1280-the witch face was working and twitching with passion , but [his]72-aslan looked up at the sky , still quiet , neither angry nor afraid , but a little sad . Then , just before [she]1280-the witch gave the blow , [she]1280-the witch stooped down and said in a quivering voice ,

" And now , who has won ? [Fool]1654-fool , did [you]1654-fool think that by all this [you]1654-fool would save [the human traitor]1772-the human traitor ? Now [I]1280-the witch will kill [you]391-the children instead of [him]72-aslan as [our]1773-our pact was and so the Deep Magic will be appeased . But when [you]391-the children are dead what will prevent [me]1280-the witch from killing [him]72-aslan as well ? And who will take [him]72-aslan out of [my]1280-the witch hand _ then _ ? Understand that [you]391-the children have given [me]1280-the witch [Narnia]7-narnia forever , [you]391-the children have lost [your]391-the children own life and [you]391-the children have not saved [his]72-aslan . In that knowledge , despair and die . "[1280-the witch]

[The children]391-the children did not see the actual moment of the killing . [They]391-the children could n't bear to look and had covered [their]391-the children eyes .

CHAPTER XV

_ Deeper Magic from _ before _ the Dawn of Time _

While [the two girls]355-the two girls still crouched in the bushes with [their]355-the two girls hands over [their]355-the two girls faces , [they]355-the two girls heard the voice of [the Witch]1280-the witch calling out .

" Now ! Follow [me]1280-the witch all and [we]391-the children will set about what remains of this war ! It will not take [us]391-the children long to crush [the human vermin]1774-the human vermin and [the traitors]1775-the traitors now that [the great Fool]1776-the great fool , [the great Cat]1777-the great cat , lies dead . "[1280-the witch]

At this moment [the children]391-the children were for a few seconds in very great danger . For with wild cries and a noise of skirling pipes and shrill horns blowing , the whole of [that vile rabble]973-that vile rabble came sweeping off [the hill - top]773-the hill - top and down [the slope]975-the slope right past [their]391-the children hiding - place . [They]391-the children felt [the Spectres]101-the spectres go by [them]391-the children like a cold wind and [they]391-the children felt the ground shake beneath [them]391-the children under the galloping feet of [the Minotaurs]1714-the minotaurs ; and overhead there went a flurry of foul wings and a blackness of vultures and giant bats . At any other time [they]391-the children would have trembled with fear ; but now the sadness and shame and horror of [Aslan]72-aslan 's death so filled [their]391-the children minds that [they]391-the children hardly thought of it .

As soon as the wood was silent again [Susan]40-susan and [Lucy]60-lucy crept out into [the open hill - top]977-the open hill - top . The moon was getting low and thin clouds were passing across [her]60-lucy , but still [they]391-the children could see the shape of the great Lion lying dead in [his]72-aslan bonds . And down [they]391-the children both knelt in the wet grass and kissed [his]72-aslan cold face and stroked [his]72-aslan beautiful fur -- what was left of it -- and cried till [they]391-the children could cry no more . And then [they]391-the children looked at [each other]162-each other and held [each other]162-each other 's hands for mere loneliness and cried again ; and then again were silent . At last [Lucy]60-lucy said ,

" [I]60-lucy ca n't bear the look of that horrible muzzle . [I]60-lucy wonder could [we]391-the children take it off ? "[60-lucy]

So [they]391-the children tried . And after a lot of working at it ( for [their]391-the children fingers were cold and it was now the darkest part of the night ) [they]391-the children succeeded . And when [they]391-the children saw [his]72-aslan face without it [they]391-the children burst out crying again and kissed it and fondled it and wiped away the blood and the foam as well as [they]391-the children could . And it was all more lonely and hopeless and horrid than [I]0-i know how to describe .

" [I]40-susan wonder could [we]391-the children untie [him]72-aslan as well ? "[40-susan] said [Susan]40-susan presently . But [the enemies]947-the enemies , out of pure spitefulness had drawn the cords so tight that [the girls]139-the girls could make nothing of the knots .

[I]0-i hope [no one who reads this book]982-no one who reads this book has been quite as miserable as [Susan]40-susan and [Lucy]60-lucy were that night ; but if [you]983-you have been -- if [you]983-you 've been up all night and cried till [you]983-you have no more tears left in [you]983-you -- [you]983-you will know that there comes in the end a sort of quietness . [You]983-you feel as if nothing was ever going to happen again . At any rate that was how it felt to [these two]984-these two . Hours and hours seemed to go by in this dead calm , and [they]984-these two hardly noticed that [they]984-these two were getting colder and colder . But at last [Lucy]60-lucy noticed two other things . One was that the sky on [the East side]985-the east side of [the hill]860-the hill was a little less dark than it had been an hour ago . The other was some tiny movement going on in the grass at [her]60-lucy feet . At first [she]60-lucy took no interest in this . What did it matter ? Nothing mattered now ! But at last [she]60-lucy saw that whatever - it - was had begun to move up the upright stones of [the Stone Table]19-the stone table . And now whatever - [they]987-they - were were moving about on [Aslan]72-aslan 's body . [She]60-lucy peered closer . [They]987-they were little grey things .

" Ugh ! "[40-susan] said [Susan]40-susan from the other side of the Table . " How beastly ! There are horrid little mice crawling over [him]72-aslan . Go away , [you]987-they little beasts . "[40-susan] And [she]40-susan raised [her]40-susan hand to frighten [them]987-they away .

" Wait ! "[60-lucy] said [Lucy]60-lucy who had been looking at [them]987-they more closely still . " Can [you]987-they see what [they]987-they 're doing ? "[60-lucy]

[Both girls]988-both girls bent down and stared .

" [I]40-susan do believe ! "[40-susan] said [Susan]40-susan . " But how queer . [They]987-they 're nibbling away at the cords ! "[40-susan]

" That 's what [I]60-lucy thought , "[60-lucy] said [Lucy]60-lucy . " [I]60-lucy think [they]987-they 're [friendly mice]1778-friendly mice . Poor little things -- [they]987-they do n't realise [he]1779-he 's dead . [They]987-they think it 'll do some good untying [him]1779-he . "[60-lucy]

It was quite definitely lighter by now . [Each of the girls]989-each of the girls noticed for the first time the white face of [the other]990-the other . [They]988-both girls could see the mice nibbling away ; dozens and dozens , even hundreds , of little field mice . And at last , one by one , the ropes were all gnawed through .

The sky in [the East]27-the east was whitish by now and the stars were getting fainter -- all except one very big one low down on [the Eastern horizon]991-the eastern horizon . [They]992-they felt colder than [they]992-they had been all night . The mice crept away again .

[The girls]139-the girls cleared away the remains of the gnawed ropes . [Aslan]72-aslan looked more like [himself]72-aslan without [them]992-they . Every moment [his]72-aslan dead face looked nobler , as the light grew and [they]139-the girls could see it better .

In the wood behind [them]139-the girls a bird gave a chuckling sound . It had been so still for hours and hours that it startled [them]139-the girls . Then another bird answered it . Soon there were birds singing all over [the place]1425-the place .

It was quite definitely early morning now , not late night .

" [I]60-lucy 'm so cold , "[60-lucy] said [Lucy]60-lucy .

" So am [I]40-susan , "[40-susan] said [Susan]40-susan . " Let 's walk about a bit . "[40-susan]

[They]139-the girls walked to [the Eastern edge of [the hill]860-the hill]995-the eastern edge of the hill and looked down . The one big star had almost disappeared . [The country]126-the country all looked dark grey , but beyond , at the very end of [the world]1259-the world , [the sea]1565-the sea showed pale . The sky began to turn red . [They]139-the girls walked to and fro more times than [they]139-the girls could count between [the dead Aslan]72-aslan and [the Eastern ridge]1000-the eastern ridge , trying to keep warm ; and oh , how tired [their]139-the girls legs felt . Then at last , as [they]139-the girls stood for a moment looking out towards [the sea]1565-the sea and [Cair Paravel]66-cair paravel ( which [they]139-the girls could now just make out ) the red turned to gold along the line where [the sea]1565-the sea and the sky met and very slowly up came the edge of the sun . At that moment [they]139-the girls heard from behind [them]139-the girls a loud noise -- a great cracking , deafening noise as if a giant had broken a giant 's plate .

" What 's that ? "[60-lucy] said [Lucy]60-lucy , clutching [Susan]40-susan 's arm .

" [I]40-susan -- [I]40-susan feel afraid to turn round , "[40-susan] said [Susan]40-susan ; " something awful is happening . "[40-susan]

" [They]139-the girls 're doing something worse to _ [him]72-aslan _ , "[60-lucy] said [Lucy]60-lucy . " Come on ! "[60-lucy] And [she]60-lucy turned , pulling [Susan]40-susan round with [her]60-lucy .

The rising of the sun had made everything look so different -- all the colours and shadows were changed -- that for a moment [they]139-the girls did n't see the important thing . Then [they]139-the girls did . [The Stone Table]1545-the stone table was broken into two pieces by a great crack that ran down it from end to end ; and there was no [Aslan]72-aslan .

" Oh , oh , oh ! "[355-the two girls] cried [the two girls]355-the two girls rushing back to [the Table]1005-the table .

" Oh , it 's _ too _ bad , "[60-lucy] sobbed [Lucy]60-lucy ; " [they]139-the girls might have left [the body]1780-the body alone . "[60-lucy]

" Who 's done it ? "[40-susan] cried [Susan]40-susan . " What does it mean ? Is it more magic ? "[40-susan]

" Yes ! "[60-lucy] said a great voice behind [their]139-the girls backs . " It is more magic . "[60-lucy] [They]139-the girls looked round . There , shining in the sunrise , larger than [they]139-the girls had seen [him]72-aslan before , shaking [his]72-aslan mane ( for it had apparently grown again ) stood [Aslan]72-aslan [himself]72-aslan .

" Oh , [Aslan]72-aslan ! "[391-the children] cried both [the children]391-the children , staring up at [him]72-aslan , almost as much frightened as [they]391-the children were glad .

" Are n't [you]72-aslan dead then , dear [Aslan]72-aslan ? "[60-lucy] said [Lucy]60-lucy .

" Not now , "[72-aslan] said [Aslan]72-aslan .

" [You]72-aslan 're not -- not a-- ? "[40-susan] asked [Susan]40-susan in a shaky voice . [She]40-susan could n't bring [herself]40-susan to say the word _ ghost _ .

[Aslan]72-aslan stooped [his]72-aslan golden head and licked [her]40-susan forehead . The warmth of [his]72-aslan breath and a rich sort of smell that seemed to hang about [his]72-aslan hair came all over [her]60-lucy .

" Do [I]72-aslan look it ? "[72-aslan] [he]72-aslan said .

" Oh , [you]72-aslan 're real , [you]72-aslan 're real ! Oh , [Aslan]72-aslan ! "[60-lucy] cried [Lucy]60-lucy and [both girls]988-both girls flung [themselves]988-both girls upon [him]72-aslan and covered [him]72-aslan with kisses .

" But what does it all mean ? "[40-susan] asked [Susan]40-susan when [they]1008-they were somewhat calmer .

" It means , "[72-aslan] said [Aslan]72-aslan , " that though [the Witch]1280-the witch knew the Deep Magic , there is a magic deeper still which [she]1280-the witch did not know . [Her]1280-the witch knowledge goes back only to the dawn of Time . But if [she]1280-the witch could have looked a little further back , into the stillness and the darkness before Time dawned , [she]1280-the witch would have read there a different incantation . [She]1280-the witch would have known that when [a willing victim who had committed no treachery]1782-a willing victim who had committed no treachery was killed in [a traitor]1734-a traitor 's stead , the Table would crack and Death itself would start working backwards . And now--[72-aslan]

" Oh yes . Now ? "[60-lucy] said [Lucy]60-lucy jumping up and clapping [her]60-lucy hands .

" Oh , [children]117-children , "[771-the lion] said [the Lion]771-the lion , " [I]72-aslan feel [my]72-aslan strength coming back to [me]72-aslan . Oh , [children]117-children , catch [me]72-aslan if [you]117-children can ! "[72-aslan] [He]72-aslan stood for a second , [his]72-aslan eyes very bright , [his]72-aslan limbs quivering , lashing [himself]72-aslan with [his]72-aslan tail . Then [he]72-aslan made a leap high over [their]1010-them heads and landed on the other side of the Table . Laughing , though [she]60-lucy did n't know why , [Lucy]60-lucy scrambled over it to reach [him]72-aslan . [Aslan]72-aslan leaped again . A mad chase began . Round and round [the hill - top]773-the hill - top [he]72-aslan led [them]1010-them , now hopelessly out of [their]1010-them reach , now letting [them]1010-them almost catch [his]72-aslan tail , now diving between [them]1010-them , now tossing [them]1010-them in the air with [his]72-aslan huge and beautifully velveted paws and catching [them]1010-them again , and now stopping unexpectedly so that all three of [them]1010-them rolled over together in a happy laughing heap of fur and arms and legs . It was such a romp as [no one]1221-no one has ever had except in [Narnia]7-narnia ; and whether it was more like playing with a thunderstorm or playing with a kitten [Lucy]60-lucy could never make up [her]60-lucy mind . And the funny thing was that when [all three]1013-all three finally lay together panting in the sun [the girls]139-the girls no longer felt in the least tired or hungry or thirsty .

" And now , "[72-aslan] said [Aslan]72-aslan presently , " to business . [I]72-aslan feel [I]72-aslan am going to roar . [You]139-the girls had better put [your]139-the girls fingers in [your]139-the girls ears . "[72-aslan]

And [they]1010-them did . And [Aslan]72-aslan stood up and when [he]72-aslan opened [his]72-aslan mouth to roar [his]72-aslan face became so terrible that [they]1010-them did not dare to look at it . And [they]1010-them saw all the trees in front of [him]72-aslan bend before the blast of [his]72-aslan roaring as grass bends in [a meadow]1015-a meadow before the wind . Then [he]72-aslan said ,

" [We]1010-them have a long journey to go . [You]391-the children must ride on [me]72-aslan . "[72-aslan] And [he]72-aslan crouched down and [the children]391-the children climbed onto [his]72-aslan warm , golden back and [Susan]40-susan sat first holding on tightly to [his]72-aslan mane and [Lucy]60-lucy sat behind holding on tightly to [Susan]40-susan . And with a great heave [he]72-aslan rose underneath [them]1010-them and then shot off , faster than any horse could go , downhill and into the thick of [the forest]202-the forest .

That ride was perhaps the most wonderful thing that happened to [them]1010-them in [Narnia]7-narnia . Have [you]1018-you ever had a gallop on a horse ? Think of that ; and then take away the heavy noise of the hoofs and the jingle of the harness and imagine instead the almost noiseless padding of the great paws . Then imagine instead of the black or grey or chestnut back of the horse the soft roughness of golden fur , and the mane flying back in the wind . And then imagine [you]1018-you are going about twice as fast as the fastest racehorse . But this is a mount that does n't need to be guided and never grows tired . [He]72-aslan rushes on and on , never missing [his]72-aslan footing , never hesitating , threading [his]72-aslan way with perfect skill between tree - trunks , jumping over bush and briar and [the smaller streams]1019-the smaller streams , wading the larger , swimming the largest of all . And [you]1018-you are riding not on [a road]1020-a road nor in [a park]1021-a park nor even on [the downs]1022-the downs but right across [Narnia]7-narnia , in spring , down [solemn avenues of beech]1023-solemn avenues of beech and across [sunny glades of oak]1024-sunny glades of oak , through [wild orchards of snow]1025-wild orchards of snow - white cherry trees , past roaring waterfalls and mossy rocks and echoing caverns , up windy slopes alight with gorse bushes and across the shoulders of heathery mountains and along giddy ridges and down , down , down again into [wild valleys]1026-wild valleys and out into [acres of blue flowers]1027-acres of blue flowers .

It was nearly mid - day when [they]1010-them found [themselves]1010-them looking down [a steep hillside]1028-a steep hillside at [a castle]785-a castle -- [a little toy castle]1030-a little toy castle [it]785-a castle looked from where [they]1010-them stood -- which seemed to be all pointed towers . But the Lion was rushing down at such a speed that it grew larger every moment and before [they]1010-them had time even to ask [themselves]1010-them what it was [they]1010-them were already on a level with [it]785-a castle . And now [it]785-a castle no longer looked like [a toy castle]1031-a toy castle but rose frowning in front of [them]1010-them . No face looked over the battlements and the gates were fast shut . And [Aslan]72-aslan , not at all slacking [his]72-aslan pace , rushed straight as a bullet towards [it]785-a castle .

" [[The Witch]1280-the witch 's home]1787-the witch 's home ! "[72-aslan] [he]72-aslan cried . " Now , [children]117-children , hold tight . "[72-aslan]

Next moment the whole world seemed to turn upside down , and [the children]391-the children felt as if [they]391-the children had left [their]391-the children insides behind [them]391-the children ; for [the Lion]72-aslan had gathered [himself]72-aslan together for a greater leap than any [he]72-aslan had yet made and jumped -- or [you]1033-you may call it flying rather than jumping -- right over the castle wall . [The two girls]355-the two girls , breathless but unhurt , found [themselves]355-the two girls tumbling off [his]72-aslan back in the middle of [a wide stone courtyard full of statues]1035-a wide stone courtyard full of statues .

CHAPTER XVI

_ What Happened about [the Statues]39-the statues _ xvii _

" What [an extraordinary place]1789-an extraordinary place ! "[60-lucy] cried [Lucy]60-lucy . " All those stone animals -- and [people]1289-people too ! It's -- it 's like [a museum]1791-a museum . "[60-lucy]

" Hush , "[40-susan] said [Susan]40-susan , " [Aslan]72-aslan 's doing something . "[40-susan]

[He]72-aslan was indeed . [He]72-aslan had bounded up to the stone lion and breathed on [him]72-aslan . Then without waiting a moment [he]72-aslan whisked round -- almost as if [he]72-aslan had been a cat chasing its tail -- and breathed also on the stone dwarf , which ( as [you]1033-you remember ) was standing a few feet from the lion with [his]72-aslan back to it . Then [he]72-aslan pounced on a tall stone Dryad which stood beyond [the dwarf]263-the dwarf , turned rapidly aside to deal with a stone rabbit on [his]72-aslan right , and rushed on to two centaurs . But at that moment [Lucy]60-lucy said ,

" Oh , [Susan]40-susan ! Look ! Look at the lion . "[60-lucy]

[I]0-i expect [you]1033-you 've seen [someone]302-someone put a lighted match to a bit of newspaper which is propped up in a grate against an unlit fire . And for a second nothing seems to have happened ; and then [you]1033-you notice a tiny streak of flame creeping along the edge of the newspaper . It was like that now . For a second after [Aslan]72-aslan had breathed upon [him]72-aslan the stone lion looked just the same . Then a tiny streak of gold began to run along [his]72-aslan white marble back -- then it spread -- then the colour seemed to lick all over [him]72-aslan as the flame licks all over a bit of paper -- then , while [his]72-aslan hind - quarters were still obviously stone the lion shook [his]72-aslan mane and all the heavy , stony folds rippled into living hair . Then [he]72-aslan opened a great red mouth , warm and living , and gave a prodigious yawn . And now [his]72-aslan hind legs had come to life . [He]72-aslan lifted one of them and scratched [himself]72-aslan . Then , having caught sight of [Aslan]72-aslan , [he]72-aslan went bounding after [him]72-aslan and frisking round [him]72-aslan whimpering with delight and jumping up to lick [his]72-aslan face .

Of course [the children]391-the children 's eyes turned to follow the lion ; but the sight [they]391-the children saw was so wonderful that [they]391-the children soon forgot about _ [him]72-aslan _ . Everywhere the statues were coming to life . [The courtyard]1514-the courtyard looked no longer like [a museum]1791-a museum ; [it]1514-the courtyard looked more like [a zoo]1041-a zoo . [Creatures]102-creatures were running after [Aslan]72-aslan and dancing round [him]72-aslan till [he]72-aslan was almost hidden in [the crowd]964-the crowd . Instead of all that deadly white [the courtyard]1514-the courtyard was now a blaze of colours ; glossy chestnut sides of centaurs , indigo horns of unicorns , dazzling plumage of birds , reddy - brown of foxes , dogs , and satyrs , yellow stockings and crimson hoods of [dwarfs]1378-dwarfs ; and [the birch - girls]1045-the birch - girls in silver , and [the beech - girls]1046-the beech - girls in fresh , transparent green , and [the larch - girls]1047-the larch - girls in green so bright that it was almost yellow . And instead of the deadly silence [the whole place]1048-the whole place rang with the sound of happy roarings , brayings , yelpings , barkings , squealings , cooings , neighings , stampings , shouts , hurrahs , songs and laughter .

" Ooh ! "[40-susan] said [Susan]40-susan in a different tone . " Look ! [I]40-susan wonder -- [I]40-susan mean , is it safe ? "[40-susan]

[Lucy]60-lucy looked and saw that [Aslan]72-aslan had just breathed on the feet of [the stone giant]1049-the stone giant .

" It 's all right ! "[72-aslan] shouted [Aslan]72-aslan joyously . " Once the feet are put right , [all the rest of [him]72-aslan]1792-all the rest of him will follow . "[72-aslan]

" That was n't exactly what [I]40-susan meant , "[40-susan] whispered [Susan]40-susan to [Lucy]60-lucy . But it was too late to do anything about it now even if [Aslan]72-aslan would have listened to [her]60-lucy . The change was already creeping up [the Giant]103-giant rumblebuffin 's legs . Now [he]72-aslan was moving [his]72-aslan feet . A moment later [he]72-aslan lifted the club off [his]72-aslan shoulder , rubbed [his]72-aslan eyes and said ,

" Bless [me]72-aslan ! [I]72-aslan must have been asleep . Now ! Where 's that dratted little Witch that was running about on the ground . Somewhere just by [my]72-aslan feet it was . "[72-aslan] But when [everyone]153-everyone had shouted up to [him]72-aslan to explain what had really happened , and when [the Giant]1051-the giant had put [his]1051-the giant hand to [his]1051-the giant ear and got [them]153-everyone to repeat it all again so that at last [he]1051-the giant understood , then [he]1051-the giant bowed down till [his]1051-the giant head was no further off than the top of a haystack and touched [his]1051-the giant cap repeatedly to [Aslan]72-aslan , beaming all over [his]72-aslan honest ugly face , ( [giants of any sort]1052-giants of any sort are now so rare in [England]13-england and so [few giants]1053-few giants are good tempered that ten to one [you]1054-you have never seen [a giant]1055-a giant when [his]1055-a giant face is beaming . It 's a sight well worth looking at . )

" Now for the inside of [this house]1418-this house ! "[72-aslan] said [Aslan]72-aslan . " Look alive , [everyone]153-everyone . [Up stairs]1795-up stairs and down stairs and in [[[my]72-aslan lady]1796-my lady 's chamber]1797-my lady 's chamber ! Leave no corner unsearched . [You]1054-you never know where [some poor prisoner]1798-some poor prisoner may be concealed . "[72-aslan]

And into [the interior]1056-the interior [they]1057-they all rushed and for several minutes [the whole of [that dark , horrible , fusty old castle]1059-that dark , horrible , fusty old castle]1058-the whole of that dark , horrible , fusty old castle echoed with the opening of windows and with [everyone]153-everyone 's voices crying out at once " Do n't forget [the dungeons]1799-the dungeons -- Give [us]1057-they a hand with this door!--Here 's another little winding stair -- Oh ! [I]153-everyone say . Here 's a poor little kangaroo . Call [Aslan]72-aslan -- Phew ! How it smells in here -- Look out for trap - doors -- Up here ! There are a whole lot more on [the landing]1800-the landing ! "[153-everyone] But the best of all was when [Lucy]60-lucy came rushing [upstairs]137-upstairs shouting out ,

" [Aslan]72-aslan ! [Aslan]72-aslan ! [I]60-lucy 've found [Mr. Tumnus]49-mr. tumnus . Oh , do come quick . "[60-lucy]

A moment later [Lucy]60-lucy and [the little Faun]1062-the little faun were holding [one another]186-one another by both hands and dancing round and round for joy . [The little chap]1064-the little chap was none the worse for having been [a statue]557-a statue and was of course very interested in all [she]60-lucy had to tell [him]1064-the little chap .

But at last the ransacking of [the Witch 's fortress]1066-the witch 's fortress was ended . [The whole castle]1067-the whole castle stood empty with every door and window open and the light and the sweet spring air flooding in to all the dark and evil places which needed [them]1068-them so badly . [The whole crowd of liberated statues]1069-the whole crowd of liberated statues surged back into [the courtyard]1514-the courtyard . And it was then that [someone]302-someone ( [Tumnus]49-mr. tumnus , [I]0-i think ) first said ,

When all were ready ( it was [a big sheep - dog who actually helped [Aslan]72-aslan most in getting [them]1091-they sorted into [their]1091-they proper order]1090-a big sheep - dog who actually helped aslan most in getting them sorted into their proper order ) [they]1091-they set out through the gap in the castle wall . At first the lions and dogs went nosing about in all directions . But then suddenly one great hound picked up the scent and gave a bay . There was no time lost after that . Soon all the dogs and lions and wolves and other hunting animals were going at full speed with [their]1091-they noses to the ground , and [all the others]308-all the others , streaked out for about half a mile behind [them]1091-they , were following as fast as [they]1091-they could . The noise was like an English fox - hunt only better because every now and then with the music of the hounds was mixed the roar of the other lion and sometimes the far deeper and more awful roar of [Aslan]72-aslan [himself]72-aslan . Faster and faster [they]1091-they went as the scent became easier and easier to follow . And then , just as [they]1091-they came to the last curve in [a narrow , winding valley]1093-a narrow , winding valley , [Lucy]60-lucy heard above all these noises another noise -- a different one , which gave [her]60-lucy a queer feeling inside . It was a noise of shouts and shrieks and of the clashing of metal against metal .

Then [they]1091-they came out of [the narrow valley]1094-the narrow valley and at once [she]60-lucy saw the reason . There stood [Peter]38-peter and [Edmund]36-edmund and [all the rest of [[Aslan]72-aslan 's army]1096-aslan 's army]1095-all the rest of aslan 's army fighting desperately against [the crowd of horrible creatures whom [she]60-lucy had seen last night]1097-the crowd of horrible creatures whom she had seen last night ; only now , in the daylight , [they]1091-they looked even stranger and more evil and more deformed . There also seemed to be far more of [them]1091-they . [[Aslan]72-aslan 's army]1096-aslan 's army -- which had [their]1096-aslan 's army backs to [her]60-lucy -- looked terribly few . And there were statues dotted all over [the battlefield]1099-the battlefield , so apparently [the Witch]1280-the witch had been using [her]1280-the witch wand . But [she]1280-the witch did not seem to be using it now . [She]1280-the witch was fighting with [her]1280-the witch stone knife . It was [Peter]38-peter [she]60-lucy was fighting -- both of [them]1101-them going at it so hard that [Lucy]60-lucy could hardly make out what was happening ; [she]60-lucy only saw the stone knife and [Peter]38-peter 's sword flashing so quickly that they looked like three knives and three swords . That pair were in the centre . On each side the line stretched out . Horrible things were happening wherever [she]60-lucy looked .

" Off [my]72-aslan back , [children]117-children , "[72-aslan] shouted [Aslan]72-aslan . And [they]1101-them both tumbled off . CHAPTER XVII

_ The Hunting of the White Stag _

The battle was all over a few minutes after [their]1113-the newcomers arrival . [Most of [the enemy]1108-the enemy]1115-most of the enemy had been killed in the first charge of [Aslan]72-aslan and [[his]72-aslan companions]1117-his companions ; and when [those who were still living]1118-those who were still living saw that [the Witch]1280-the witch was dead [they]1118-those who were still living either gave [themselves]1118-those who were still living up or took to flight . The next thing that [Lucy]60-lucy knew was that [Peter]38-peter and [Aslan]72-aslan were shaking hands . It was strange to [her]60-lucy to see [Peter]38-peter looking as [he]38-peter looked now -- [his]38-peter face was so pale and stern and [he]38-peter seemed so much older .

" It was all [Edmund]36-edmund 's doing , [Aslan]72-aslan , "[38-peter] [Peter]38-peter was saying . " [We]1826-we 'd have been beaten if it had n't been for [him]38-peter . [The Witch]59-the witch was - turning [[our]1826-we troops]1827-our troops into stone right and left . But nothing would stop [him]38-peter . [He]38-peter fought [his]38-peter way through three ogres to where [she]59-the witch was just turning one of [your]1828-your leopards into a statue . And when [he]38-peter reached [her]59-the witch [he]38-peter had the sense to bring [his]38-peter sword smashing down on [her]59-the witch wand instead of trying to go for [her]59-the witch directly and simply getting made a statue [himself]38-peter for [his]38-peter pains . That was the mistake [all the rest]1829-all the rest were making . Once [her]59-the witch wand was broken [we]1120-we began to have some chance -- if [we]1120-we had n't lost so many already . [He]36-edmund was terribly wounded . [We]1120-we must go and see [him]36-edmund . "[38-peter]

[They]1120-we found [Edmund]36-edmund in charge of [Mrs. Beaver]73-mrs. beaver a little way back from the fighting line . [He]36-edmund was covered with blood , [his]36-edmund mouth was open , and [his]36-edmund face a nasty green colour .

" Quick , [Lucy]60-lucy , "[72-aslan] said [Aslan]72-aslan .

And then , almost for the first time , [Lucy]60-lucy remembered the precious cordial that had been given [her]60-lucy for a Christmas present . " [I]60-lucy 'm sorry , [Aslan]72-aslan , "[60-lucy] said [Lucy]60-lucy getting up and going with [him]72-aslan . " Does [he]36-edmund know , "[60-lucy] whispered [Lucy]60-lucy to [Susan]40-susan , " what [Aslan]72-aslan did for [him]36-edmund ? Does [he]36-edmund know what the arrangement with [the Witch]1280-the witch really was ? "[60-lucy]

That night [they]1128-they slept where [they]1128-they were . How [Aslan]72-aslan provided food for [them]1128-they all [I]0-i do n't know ; but somehow or other [they]1128-they found [themselves]1128-they all sitting down on the grass to a fine high tea at about eight o'clock . And , oh , the cry of the sea gulls ! Have [you]1137-you heard it ? Can [you]1137-you remember ?

That evening after tea [the four children]394-the four children all managed to get down to [the beach]1136-the beach again and get [their]394-the four children shoes and stockings off and feel the sand between [their]394-the four children toes . " Once [a king]448-a king or queen in [Narnia]7-narnia , always [a king or queen]1836-a king or queen . Bear it well , [Sons of [Adam]48-adam]1681-sons of adam ! Bear it well , [Daughters of [Eve]48-adam]1838-daughters of eve ! "[72-aslan] said [Aslan]72-aslan .

So [the children]391-the children sat in [their]391-the children thrones and sceptres were put into [their]391-the children hands and [they]391-the children gave rewards and honours to all [[their]391-the children friends]1143-their friends , to [Tumnus the Faun]108-tumnus the faun , and to [the Beavers]37-the beavers , and [Giant Rumblebuffin]103-giant rumblebuffin , to the leopards , and the good centaurs and [the good dwarfs]1149-the good dwarfs , and to the lion . But amidst all these rejoicings [Aslan]72-aslan [himself]72-aslan quietly slipped away . And when [the Kings and Queens]1151-the kings and queens noticed that [he]72-aslan was n't [there]283-there [they]1151-the kings and queens said nothing about it . For [Mr. Beaver]71-mr. beaver had warned [them]1151-the kings and queens , " [He]72-aslan 'll be coming and going "[71-mr. beaver] [he]71-mr. beaver had said . " One day [you]1151-the kings and queens 'll see [him]72-aslan and another [you]1151-the kings and queens wo n't . [He]72-aslan does n't like being tied down -- and of course [he]72-aslan has [other countries to attend to]1839-other countries to attend to . It 's quite all right . [He]72-aslan 'll often drop in . Only [you]1151-the kings and queens must n't press [him]72-aslan . [He]72-aslan 's wild , [you]1151-the kings and queens know . Not like a _ tame _ lion . "[71-mr. beaver]

And now , as [you]1153-you see , this story is nearly ( but not quite ) at an end . [These two Kings]1154-these two kings and [two Queens]1155-two queens governed [Narnia]7-narnia well and long and happy was [their]1154-these two kings reign . At first much of [their]1154-these two kings time was spent in seeking out [the remnants of [the White Witch]1261-the white witch 's army]1156-the remnants of the white witch 's army and destroying [them]1156-the remnants of the white witch 's army , and indeed for a long time there would be news of evil things lurking in [the wilder parts of [the forest]202-the forest]1158-the wilder parts of the forest -- a haunting here and a killing there , a glimpse of [a werewolf]1160-a werewolf one month and a rumour of [a hag]1161-a hag the next . But in the end all that foul brood was stamped out . And [they]1154-these two kings made good laws and kept the peace and saved good trees from being unnecessarily cut down , and liberated [young dwarfs]1162-young dwarfs and [young satyrs]1163-young satyrs from being sent to [school]1304-school , and generally stopped [busybodies]1165-busybodies and [interferers]1166-interferers and encouraged [ordinary people who wanted to live and let live]1167-ordinary people who wanted to live and let live . And [they]1154-these two kings drove back the fierce giants ( quite a different sort from [Giant Rumblebuffin]103-giant rumblebuffin ) on [the North of [Narnia]7-narnia]1168-the north of narnia when these ventured across the frontier . And [they]1154-these two kings entered into friendship and alliance with [countries beyond [the sea]1565-the sea]1169-countries beyond the sea and paid [them]1169-countries beyond the sea visits of [state]1171-state and received visits of [state]1171-state from [them]1169-countries beyond the sea . And [they]1154-these two kings [themselves]1154-these two kings grew and changed as the years passed over [them]1154-these two kings . And [Peter]38-peter became [a tall and deep chested man]1173-a tall and deep chested man and [a great warrior]1174-a great warrior , and [he]38-peter was called [King Peter the Magnificent]109-king peter . And [Susan]40-susan grew into [a tall and gracious woman with black hair]1175-a tall and gracious woman with black hair that fell almost to [her]40-susan feet and [the Kings of [the countries beyond [the sea]1565-the sea]1177-the countries beyond the sea]1176-the kings of the countries beyond the sea began to send [ambassadors]1179-ambassadors asking for [her]40-susan hand in marriage . And [she]40-susan was called [Queen Susan the Gentle]40-susan . [Edmund]36-edmund was [a graver and quieter man]1180-a graver and quieter man than [Peter]109-king peter , and great in council and judgement . [He]36-edmund was called [King Edmund the Just]36-edmund . But as for [Lucy]107-queen lucy , [she]107-queen lucy was always gay and golden haired , and [all Princes in [those parts]1182-those parts]1181-all princes in those parts desired [her]107-queen lucy to be [[their]1181-all princes in those parts Queen]1183-their queen , and [[her]107-queen lucy own people]1184-her own people called [her]107-queen lucy Queen [Lucy the Valiant]110-lucy the valiant .

So [they]1181-all princes in those parts lived in great joy and if ever [they]1181-all princes in those parts remembered [their]1181-all princes in those parts life in [this world]1185-this world it was only as [one]1408-one remembers a dream . And one year it fell out that [Tumnus]108-tumnus the faun ( who was [a middle - aged Faun by now and beginning to be stout]1187-a middle - aged faun by now and beginning to be stout ) came down [river]1188-river and brought [them]1181-all princes in those parts news that [the White Stag]1189-the white stag had once more appeared in [[his]1189-the white stag parts]1190-his parts -- [the White Stag who would give [you]1191-you wishes if [you]1191-you caught [him]1189-the white stag]111-the white stag who would give you wishes if you caught him . So [these two Kings]1154-these two kings and [two Queens]1155-two queens with [the principal members of [[their]1154-these two kings court]1195-their court]1194-the principal members of their court , rode a - hunting with horns and hounds in [the Western Woods]31-the western woods to follow [the White Stag]111-the white stag who would give you wishes if you caught him . And [they]1181-all princes in those parts had not hunted long before [they]1181-all princes in those parts had a sight of [him]111-the white stag who would give you wishes if you caught him . And [he]111-the white stag who would give you wishes if you caught him led [them]1181-all princes in those parts a great pace over rough and smooth and through thick and thin , till the horses of [all the courtiers]1196-all the courtiers were tired out and [only these four]1197-only these four were still following . And [they]1181-all princes in those parts saw [the stag]1198-the stag enter into a thicket where [their]1181-all princes in those parts horses could not follow . Then said [King Peter]109-king peter ( for [they]1181-all princes in those parts talked in quite a different style now , having been [Kings and Queens]1199-kings and queens for so long ) " [Fair Consorts]1840-fair consorts , let [us]1181-all princes in those parts now alight from [our]1181-all princes in those parts horses and follow this beast into [the thicket]1841-the thicket ; for in all [my]109-king peter days [I]109-king peter never hunted [a nobler quarry]1842-a nobler quarry . "[109-king peter]

" [Sir]1405-sir , "[1252-the others] said [the others]1252-the others , " even so let [us]1181-all princes in those parts do . "[1252-the others]

So [they]1181-all princes in those parts alighted and tied [their]1181-all princes in those parts horses to trees and went on into [the thick wood]1201-the thick wood on foot . And as soon as [they]1181-all princes in those parts had entered it [Queen Susan]40-susan said ,

" [Fair friends]1844-fair friends , here is a great marvel , for [I]40-susan seem to see a tree of iron . "[40-susan]

" Madam , "[36-edmund] said [King Edmund]36-edmund , " if [you]40-susan look well upon it [you]40-susan shall see it is a pillar of iron with a lantern set on the top thereof . "[36-edmund]

" Marry , a strange device , "[109-king peter] said [King Peter]109-king peter , " to set a lantern here where the trees cluster so thick about it and so high above it that if it were lit it should give light to [no man]1845-no man ! "[109-king peter]

" [Sir]1405-sir , "[107-queen lucy] said [Queen Lucy]107-queen lucy . " By likelihood when this post and this lamp were set here there were smaller trees in [the place]1425-the place , or fewer , or none . For this is a young wood and the iron post is old . "[107-queen lucy] And [they]1181-all princes in those parts stood looking upon it . Then said [King Edmund]36-edmund ,

" [I]109-king peter know not how it is , but this lamp on the post worketh upon [me]109-king peter strangely . It runs in [my]109-king peter mind that [I]109-king peter have seen the like before ; as it were in a dream , or in the dream of a dream . "[109-king peter]

" [Sir]1405-sir , "[1181-all princes in those parts] answered [they]1181-all princes in those parts all , " it is even so with [us]1181-all princes in those parts also . "[1181-all princes in those parts]

" And more , "[107-queen lucy] said [Queen Lucy]107-queen lucy , " for it will not go out of [my]107-queen lucy mind that if [we]1181-all princes in those parts pass this post and lantern , either [we]1181-all princes in those parts shall find strange adventures or else some great change of [our]1181-all princes in those parts fortunes . "[107-queen lucy]

" [Madam]1849-madam , "[36-edmund] said [King Edmund]36-edmund , " the like foreboding stirreth in [my]36-edmund heart also . "[36-edmund]

" And in [mine]109-king peter , [fair brother]1850-fair brother , "[109-king peter] said [King Peter]109-king peter .

" And in [mine]40-susan too , "[40-susan] said [Queen Susan]40-susan . " Wherefore by [my]40-susan council [we]1181-all princes in those parts shall lightly return to [our]1181-all princes in those parts horses and follow this White Stag no further . "[40-susan]

" [Madam]1849-madam , "[109-king peter] said [King Peter]109-king peter , " therein [I]109-king peter pray [thee]1849-madam to have [me]109-king peter excused . For never since [we]1181-all princes in those parts four were [Kings]1852-kings and Queens in [Narnia]7-narnia have [we]1181-all princes in those parts set [our]1181-all princes in those parts hands to any high matter , as battles , quests , feats of arms , acts of justice , and the like , and then given over ; but always what [we]1181-all princes in those parts have taken in hand , the same [we]1181-all princes in those parts have achieved . "[109-king peter]

" [Sister]112-sister , "[107-queen lucy] said [Queen Lucy]107-queen lucy , " [[my]107-queen lucy royal brother]1853-my royal brother speaks rightly . And it seems to [me]107-queen lucy [we]1181-all princes in those parts should be shamed if for any fearing or foreboding [we]1181-all princes in those parts turned back from following so noble a beast as now [we]1181-all princes in those parts have in chase . "[107-queen lucy]

" And so say [I]36-edmund , "[36-edmund] said [King Edmund]36-edmund . " And [I]36-edmund have such desire to find the signification of this thing that [I]36-edmund would not by [my]36-edmund good will turn back for the richest jewel in [all Narnia]1745-all narnia and [all the islands]1855-all the islands . "[36-edmund]

" Then in the name of [Aslan]72-aslan , "[40-susan] said [Queen Susan]40-susan , " if [ye]1856-ye will all have it so , let [us]1181-all princes in those parts go on and take the adventure that shall fall to [us]1181-all princes in those parts . "[40-susan]

So [these Kings]1202-these kings and [Queens]1146-queens entered the thicket , and before [they]1202-these kings had gone a score of paces [they]1202-these kings all remembered that the thing [they]1202-these kings had seen was called a lamp - post , and before [they]1202-these kings had gone twenty more , [they]1202-these kings noticed that [they]1202-these kings were making [their]1202-these kings way not through branches but through coats . And next moment [they]1202-these kings all came tumbling out of a wardrobe door into [the empty room]224-the empty room , and [they]1202-these kings were no longer [Kings]1852-kings and [Queens]1146-queens in [their]1202-these kings hunting array but just [Peter]109-king peter , [Susan]40-susan , [Edmund]36-edmund and [Lucy]107-queen lucy in [their]1202-these kings old clothes . It was the same day and the same hour of the day on which [they]1202-these kings had all gone into the wardrobe to hide . [Mrs. Macready]41-mrs. macready and [the visitors]1207-the visitors were still talking in [the passage]223-the passage ; but luckily [they]1202-these kings never came into [the empty room]224-the empty room and so [the children]391-the children were n't caught .

And that would have been the very end of the story if it had n't been that [they]1202-these kings felt [they]1202-these kings really must explain to [the Professor]136-the professor why four of the coats out of [his]136-the professor wardrobe were missing . And [the Professor]136-the professor , who was [a very remarkable man]1213-a very remarkable man , did n't tell [them]1202-these kings not to be silly or not to tell lies , but believed the whole story . " No , "[136-the professor] [he]136-the professor said , " [I]136-the professor do n't think it will be any good trying to go back through the wardrobe door to get the coats . [You]1857-you wo n't get into [Narnia]7-narnia again by _ that _ route . Nor would the coats be much use by now if [you]1857-you did ! Eh ? What 's that ? Yes , of course [you]1857-you 'll get back to [Narnia]7-narnia again some day . Once [a King in [Narnia]7-narnia]1858-a king in narnia , always [a King in [Narnia]7-narnia]1858-a king in narnia . But do n't go trying to use the same route twice . Indeed , do n't _ try _ to get [there]283-there at all . It 'll happen when [you]1857-you 're not looking for it . And do n't talk too much about it even among [yourselves]1857-you . And do n't mention it to [anyone else]342-anyone else unless [you]1857-you find that [they]342-anyone else 've had adventures of the same sort [themselves]342-anyone else . What 's that ? How will [you]1857-you know ? Oh , [you]1857-you 'll _ know _ all right . Odd things , [they]342-anyone else say -- even [their]342-anyone else looks -- will let the secret out . Keep [your]1857-you eyes open . Bless [me]136-the professor , what _ do _ [they]342-anyone else teach [them]342-anyone else at [these schools]1410-these schools ? "[136-the professor]

And that is the very end of the adventures of the wardrobe . But if [the Professor]136-the professor was right it was only the beginning of the adventures of [Narnia]7-narnia .

_ The End _
